Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: supareds
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Shoreham for our 1st trip to New York. The best bit about this hotel is its location, so close to Times Square and Central Park. The hotel was clean and friendly, although the room itself was rather small (we were previously staying in a 5 star hotel in Vegas previously, so expectations were high) - we had our bags covering the entrance hall and it was difficult to move around. This didnt bother us though as we didnt spend much time in the hotel. Reception was pretty helpful, although he did recommend a "reasonably priced good value" Italian restaurant close by that turned out to be super expensive - there were much nicer restaurants in the immediate area with better menu prices. All in all the other suggestion worked well and we were pleased with the service we got. Would definitely recommend staying there to all friends and family who want a taste of what NYC is about and be in the thick of the action

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Exceeded”
Reviews.Author: noodlejudah
Reviews.Content: I read recently that most NYC tourists have such low expectations that it doesn't take much to exceed them. Such a bitter attitude is not necessary at the Shoreham. It was great. Affordable, by NYC standards, very awesome staff, and the rooms were fine. They were clean, somewhat spacious and had nice sheets and towels. I wasn't there to wallow in my room, so it was good. But a few really good things. Free decent coffee and free good wireless in the room. Seriously, everyone charges for wireless so that was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights here in March, 2012, but moved out after one night. Traveling with our teenage son, we were attracted by the Jr. Suite, the reasonable rates with third night free, and the good location. The staff was pleasant and accomodating, but other aspects of the hotel created our desire to seek other accomodations. Despite nighttime temperatures in the 40s, the building heat had been shut off. The spa bathroom felt moldy and was inoperative, and the spa jets exuded a very unpleasant odor. The very nice mechanical staff person who came to remedy the spa was obviously untrained, and after it started spontaneously with no one in the tub, we had it shut off for fear of fire. The sitting room of the Jr. Suite had no acoustic and visual privacy from the bedroom, and the sitting room's bed was a too-short foam block, which our son likened to sleeping on a lego. The TV channels were not all available, and the mechanical person said they hadn't been able to get them fixed. The hallways and elevators were very cramped, and there was a morning line for coffee in front of a complex espresso machine that guests had trouble operating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stayed with kids”
Reviews.Author: MomInBeantown
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during April vacation 2011 for sister's/kids weekend. The hotel had online special offering 3rd night free which allowed us to book a two room suite. The suite was great with a large king bedroom, bathroom and flat screen TV in an area separated by frosted sliding doors. The "living area" had a massage chair (which the kids loved) another flat screen TV and a day bed which was great for sitting but wasn't that comfortable as a sleeping bed. The bathroom was a bit small with not much getting ready space but the living area had a desk which worked out great. The staff was accomodating and made our day bed quickly and were quick to respond when I accidentally broke the glass shelf in the bathroom (watch out - not anchored too securely). The lobby/bar area is modern and they had a trio performing during happy hour which we enjoyed. Champagne at check-in was nice touch and the location can't be beat. We had a street facing room and it wasn't' too loud at any time. There's a Dunkin' Donuts a few doors down which was good for a quick breakfast and parking, although $$, was convenient in a garage next door. I would stay here again - maybe next time without the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. If you get a great rate....go for it.”
Reviews.Author: excentrus
Reviews.Content: This is a complicated review. Possibly because I booked the "superior queen" on a third party site I was initially given un unacceptable a room....on a lower floor, very small with one small window looking over a bank of NOISY air conditioners. I complained and this was rectified immediately. Second room was actually far better, on an upper floor, no street view but VERY quiet. Window opened for fresh air. Bed was extremely comfortable, great sheets and pillows. Everything worked perfectly...massage chair, free WIFI, flat-screen TV, BOSE sound system. Not a lot of room in bedroom but great bathroom, walk-in shower/no bath. Spotless. Eveda amenities. Fluffy white towels/no bathrobe. This accommodation was perfect for me....but I can understand that it will not be satisfactory for others. Not a lot of storage space and no desk to speak of...just a narrow workspace. The hotel is in two adjoining buildings with two entrances. Modern design...lots of citrus colours, greens and greys....odd common areas, not really functional. I rarely saw a doorman/porter. The building where my room was located had an entrance near a bar/restaurant. There was never a doorman present and you did not have to walk past the front desk. I did not use the bar/restaurant so cannot comment. The location is absolutely PERFECT....you can not beat 5th Avenue and 55th Street. This hotel is located next to two major five star hotels....so you get the picture. Lots of food options just outside the hotel door. Great access to subways/buses. The front desk staff were helpful, once the initial room situation was settled. The housekeeping did an excellent job. Great free expresso machine on ground floor in one of the buildings. So, if you book here....especially through a third-party site, make sure you check out the room before settling in. I have the impression that some are MUCH better than others. Would I stay here again....definitely. Especially if I was on a museum/theatre trip and only if I got a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Super location - missed the bubbly”
Reviews.Author: jaimeGL
Reviews.Content: Hubs and i visited Shoreham for a week-end and got a great rate. He went off to park the car and I checked in. Wasn't offered a glass of bubbly which was a misstep but we were upgraded to a king, so won't whine. It never hurts to ask. Overall, we were pleased. The room was a tad on the small side. But the bed was very comfy. Tiny closet, and very little vanity in bathroom. The tub was very deep and climbing in an out an adventure. The room and bathroom were very clean. We were on the penthouse floor and it was quiet. The a/c needed looking at and they responded very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “A surprise in Central Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: livingcoward
Reviews.Content: This centrally placed hotel was a real surprise. I had read some so-so reviews b, clear guidance and a welcoming smile. The stay was organised by a travel agent in the UK who got the reservation at an amazingly competitive price for this location. The 'superior' room was indeed so - a large room with king-sized bed, big screen TV, an immersion shower (6 spray heads), free wifi, great spread of lobby and bar lounges, free fresh made coffee, tea etc. 24/7, a very helpful and, by today's standards, a large number of helpful and polite staff. Good responses to telephone enquiries to reception and housekeeping. Modern with minimalist touches in terms of decor but definitely a 'come again' venue.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with personal attitude”
Reviews.Author: leorma
Reviews.Content: The minute you step in you understand that the staff is here for you to help you in any way. The welcome champagne was great. We came with a car and they kept an eye on it for an hour for free and the rooms are furnished beautifully

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: Allan A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Shoreham with a bunch of friends for New Years Eve. Nice boutique hotel in a great location, which is not far from the main action but also on a fairly quiet street, so not much noise at night. The rooms are quite small but really nice and there is a nice cocktail bar downstairs, which we used a few times. Staff were really nice and overall, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mid-town location”
Reviews.Author: stephenrappaport
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family overnight for a weekend in the city. Chose location because most of the touring, shopping and theater we wanted was nearby and easy walks. Pros: boutique hotel, nicely appointed, comfortable beds, quality amenities, pleasant check-in and staff experiences. Cons: bathroom toilet was not as clean as we would have liked - there was a spot of dried pee on it, and the ceiling in the shower was cracking. I left a comment card with the desk at checkout and was told that housekeeping would get it right away.

Reviews.Title: “chute boutique hôtel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ICNNCI
Reviews.Content: We stayed for about a week at their executive suite on the penthouse level; it came with an outdoor patio. Room was worth the extra $. BTW, we didn't eat at the hotel, so we can't say how good the food was. Pros: room was larger than most NY hotel rooms and very clean; great king-sized mattress (real king, btw, not the shrunken king at some hotels) that was just firm enough. Separate oversized shower & tub combo. Larger bathroom. Outdoor patio access via glass sliding doors, lots of natural light, quiet (room was at back of hotel); efficient & courteous staff - extras we asked for came promptly. They stored our luggage with no hassle. Easy booking a car to the airport ($85 one-way transfer, plus tax, tip). And, great location! The hotel is on a quiet street but it's only half-block away from shopping on 5th ave. and both high- and low-end restaurants. It's also only a few blocks from Rockefeller, Times Square, Broadway, MoMA, Central Park, Trump, subway, etc. There's also a food mart around the corner at 55 & 6. We tried out different delis, and as the Peninsula is half-block away, and we splurged on their breakfast buffet twice - yum! Never had problem catching a cab at front of the hotel. cons: bathroom door does not lock! There's limited counter space around the sink, and only one hard chair and the massage chair in the room. There's a tiny desk and very little room to put your things away. The patio is lovely, but it's shared with the suite next door w/o a privacy wall/fence. Also, the vents would emit smoke odor into our room (I suspect this happened when someone on our floor was smoking in their room). Honestly, if it wasn't for the shared patio leading to lack of privacy/security, I think I would have given the hotel 5 stars - but it freaked me out that whoever was staying next door could walk over anytime to the glass sliding doors and look in. Further, I noticed the patio isn't enclosed - it seems to encircle the roof level all around the building - we heard someone (we hope/assume it was the hotel security) walk past the glass door at dark, so we assumed others (staff, etc.) had access to that patio area at all times. The sliding glass door didn't look all that secure to me, so that was a major concern as well. If they can fix that, I'd give the hotel 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoJilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shoreham because we got a really good deal online. 3rd night free. We were greeted with champagne at check in. Nice after a long day of travel. Our room was on the 8th floor with a view of the street. Room was decorated very modern. It was a little small but adequate. It had a wonderful massage chair. Bed was comfy and everything was clean. They sent up a bottle of champagne and a bowl of strawberries to celebrate our anniversary. We asked the front desk a lot of questions about directions and they were all always very helpful. I would stay there again if I got a great deal. Location was close to everything. There is a dunkin donuts a few doors down to grab something for breakfast. They had oatmeal and bagels too.

Reviews.Title: “NEW YEARS EVE 2011 ONTO 2012 WITH 9 OF US IN ONE 2 BEDROOM HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: J1HOLMES
Reviews.Content: Location was INCREDIBLE!, to put it lightly. First of all my friend wanted to get the best price for the value and quailty. She went through Price line. She got it for $350 a night for each 2 nights total bill was $850.00 including taxes and Valet parking in which it was $45 a day for New Years Eve and day. The only issue I had with Price Line will give you one of the cheapest rates, but there is a catch to it, you get what you pay for. A one small room with one bed. Thank God I called the hotel manager for the upgrade a week before we left. I had to pay another $125 a night for a 2 bedroom apartment style hotel, that was well worth it, since to rooms were so small. Well we wanted to go cheap, so there was 9 of us in the 2 bedroom apartment style hotel. I was trying to have every one spend $100 for 2 nights in New York City was quite challenge. There me, my sister Mishell, Brett, Jordan, Nicole, Andy, Jen, Tonya, and Angie. Cramped in the rooms. I was to trying to was cleverly orastrated the sleeping arrangement. First got to the room, I did not expect the rooms to be that small. The way the pictures show it to be large, in-which it was very small. So my friend Tonya and Angie stayed in one room. My sister and I stayed In so called living room. The rest them in the master bed room. Thank god, I brought an air mattress, put next to there bed. So 5 of them in the room, after all that I needed a drink. Back to the hotel. As I said" Great location in New York 55th close to Central park and great walking distance to Time Square". Hotel was very contemporary. Clean room, but very small living room. The only issue we had was the standing shower flooded the bathroom floor. Guest service was great. They always brought us tons so towels, toiletry and ice. Overall I would stay here again, very friendly staff and manager did a great job to service us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Liketravelling37
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great service, good location. I booked a junior suite which was great. The room was smaller than I expected and the bathroom was tiny, I gained a few bruises from negotiating doors. But I guess that is New York in terms of room space. The room wasn't as modern as the flashy reception area and It was a little tired. My daughter loved the massage chair and it was great for a 10 year old because we had the sitting room to watch a movie in the evenings once we had finished carriage rides and cycling around central park...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jmww
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights over the long MLK weekend and was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The room was very spacious for NYC. The bathroom was on the smaller side, but everything fit adequately. The shower was fantastic, and the bed comfortable. I got a room facing a back alley and am so glad I did; there was no noise at all. My only small complaint was that the room I was assigned was an adjoining room. I could hear the couple next door as they spoke in a normal, conversational, tone of voice. When I mentioned this to the front desk, they were very helpful and without hesitation offered to move me to a room without a door to an adjoining room. I was in a rush and declined, and ultimately it was not an issue. The hotel was very convenient for my needs. I was glad that there are 2 Starbucks, a Dunkin Donuts, a Duane Reade, a wine shop and a supermarket within a couple of blocks.

Reviews.Title: “stolen property”
Reviews.Author: Lineke P
Reviews.Content: The maid admitted taking $800. sunglasses in a bag from the room thinking they were trash. The hotel was not willing to compensate me or put it thru their insurance. No customer service. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: DC-Dad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shoreham over Christmas weekend, chosen because we received a great rate that saved hundreds of dollars on 2 rooms over 3 days. We were nervous, but pleasantly surprised. Rooms were modern & clean. There was a champagne welcome at registration, and free coffee/espresso/cappuccino/hot chocolate in the lobby 24/7. We walked easily to all the Xmas 5th Ave. sites & to our Broadway show & Central Park. The rooms were very small -- the comfortable queen-size bed took up almost all the floor space, & the window looked out on another building. But who goes to NYC to stay in a hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Suite, Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: ReenaRani
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom king suite which is basically two rooms split by dividing doors ...one for sleeping, the other for lounging. Great adjustable lighting and comfortable furniture, including a leather massage chair. No additional charges for Wifi. As much complimentary cappacino as you please. I had let the hotel know in advance we were celebrating our five year wedding anniversary and would like to be on a high floor, away from noise. We could still hear outside traffic but it is NYC, so we weren't that bothered. The management here does everything right. They surprised us with a bottle of bubbly and fancy chocolates on the house. Complimentary New York Times -- even the Sunday version. Wonderful stay...got everything we wanted. We reserved their stay two nights - get the third night free package ...still ended up being $400+ a night but so worth it for our special weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location! Roomy for NYC”
Reviews.Author: CruiseLori
Reviews.Content: Took a Mother daughter shopping trip with my 17 year daughter and her friend and Mother the first weekend in December. Check-in was efficient, our flight got in early, so the bellman stored our bags and we headed out to find some lunch and the hotel called me when our room was ready. We were on the penthouse level and the room was spacious for the 4 of us, with a large bathroom and a small balcony. Aveda bath products were a plus. The beds were amazingly comfy and did not hear any noises at all from the top floor. Loved the coffee machine in the lobby, but also loved the fact that there was a Dunkin Donuts just a couple doors down, since we do not have them in MN! Free wi-fi which worked well, and also computers and printers available to print out show tickets and boarding passes in the lobby. The location was central to everything! Was an easy couple block walk to shopping, Central Park and Rockefellar Center. Was a few blocks further but doable with the balmy weather we had that weekend to Times Square. Felt safe walking around the area. Bellman was once again helpful and stored our bags the day of check-out since we had a late afternoon flight, he also arranged for a towne car to be there to take us to the airport when we returned. Would definately return to the Shoreham again, provided us with a reasonable priced comfy place to call home for the weekend of shopping and sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: evil_lina
Reviews.Content: Wow, I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel. I booked through Priceline so had no control over which hotel I got but couldn't be happier with my stay. The staff was incredibly friendly both at check in and every other time I interacted with them. The complimentary sparkling wine upon check in and the 24-hour free coffee and tea facilities were a godsend. The location is perfect: 1/2 a block off of 5th Avenue with all of the glitzy shops, just a few blocks down from Central Park, and within walking distance of Rockefeller Center. A great home base for exploring Midtown and the rest of Manhattan via the Subway. The room itself, while on the small side as you'd expect in NYC, was fine for three adults, our luggage, and our multitude of purchases. Everything felt clean and modern without seeming sterile. The staff kindly held our luggage for us after we checked out so we could enjoy the city for a few more hours before our bus home. Oh, and free Wi-Fi? How nice is that? I'm amused by the reviews that comment on how unassuming the entrance to the hotel is. Sure, it's nothing more special than a door, convenient for getting in and out of the hotel, and a large sign announcing the hotel's presence but what do you expect? The Peninsula Hotel on the same street has an impressive stairway complete with a doorman, even impressive mood lighting at night, but then you'll pay nearly three times as much for a room there. As far as I'm concerned The Shoreham is a perfect gem, a real bargain in a city not known for such a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Davidjx
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, very small rooms. However, they are immaculate. Overall, a good value for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Small, good location”
Reviews.Author: Nimisis303
Reviews.Content: I have been to Europe, if you have too then you know what I am talking about when I say the hotel is European style. First off, the check in is nice enough, service was ok with champagne upon receiving your keys. Kinda snobby, but ok. The elevators are made for two people, very small. The room we had, 804 is the equivalent of a shoebox. The bed is small, a queen but I am used to a cal king. Tv was smaller, mounted on the wall... Carpet a little worn, bed was great as well as the pillows. Might I mention that this hotel washes all bedding between guests, no stinky comforters here! On to the bathroom... The door to the bathroom was frosted glass which is ok, but the door seems like an afterthought, there was a huge gap between the door and the door jamb. This created an awkward environment for those wishing to use the toilet in private because this gap allowed people in the room to see your rear end. The sink was as wide as my toothbrush, no storage whatsoever. Very trendy fixtures, soapstone counter. The shower had a rain showerhead and four wall mounted heads. Again, European style where you adjust temperature and intensiy separate from each other. The problem here is that the drain didn't work well so soon enough your were standing in a pool of your own dirty water and there was no vent in the bathroom. The ac in the unit was a little loud but tolerable. The windows opened with no screens. Our room faced other rooms so yes put down your blinds. Would I stay here again? Absolutely not.

Reviews.Title: “As Midtown as it gets”
Reviews.Author: cg37
Reviews.Content: If you're doing business In NY the Shoreham deserves your serious consideration. Not only is it in a walk-to location for any appointments on Madison or 5th avenue, it's close to several subways. For a slight and very reasonable price upgrade you can get a nicely appointed, good-sized room. The boutique atmosphere is very appealing if you like the non-chain ambience and scale, and the close proximity to everything while enjoying a - sort-of - residential feel to the location makes for a wonderful, productive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: johng1974
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend at the Shoreham Hotel in NYC. It was my first time staying at this property and I was a little bit nervous based on some of the past reviews. I think that it is tough to impress me but this hotel did. What I really liked about this hotel is that they don't "nickel and dime" you, free wifi, free use of business center computers and printer, free coffee, tea, espresso (self serve) and free champagne at check in. The room that I had was nicely designed, clean and quiet. It is true that the hotel is starting to look a little tired, but all the positives far out weighted the some what tired design (subjective). Some people might find the room layout a little quirky, it is not a Marriott, it is more like a european hotel. The location can't be beat, you can walk to everything!

Reviews.Title: “ok, a real average.”
Reviews.Author: danielgustav
Reviews.Content: the entrance is a downer, this type of door is used at average dry cleaners as well, metal, small, you got to push it, so it opens. the mattress is hanging through to the point where lying on the belly forces oneself to make a weird bend, room service and cleaning both good, bath tiny but nice. the area, if one likes to live amongst stores of big brands such as sara, gucci, etc, is perfect. not for a younger, culturally interested audience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot in the Middle of the Action”
Reviews.Author: kidsgotoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Shoreham for the first time on a business trip to Manhatthan. I normally stay in large brand hotels when there, but this time I tried The Shoreham and was happy. Happy mainly with the rate and the location. It is hard to get a great rate on weekdays in that location. The hotel reminded me of Europe, which I thought was cool. The bar was very modern. The room was small, but adequate, and the amenities were Aveda, which was an added treat. Four things that stood out for this hotel on my visit. First, location. 5th and 55th. Second, the complimentary coffee maker downstairs had many, many choices. Third, the hotel was silent (I saw other reviews about loud rooms) and the bed was very comfortable. Finally, the staff was nice, but I was able to sneak in and out without being bugged. That made it feel more like a home, which I like. I have stayed all over that area of Manhatthan and if the rate is right, I will stay at The Shoreham again.

Reviews.Title: “Shoreham a Winner”
Reviews.Author: IslandMark
Reviews.Content: Booked the Shoreham on Priceline ($280 nt X 2 Nights Total w tax $685) for a Christmas time weekend getaway to NYC with my wife. We were greeted warmly by the front desk staff and informed that no rooms were ready (it was only 11:00am) and they were happy to take our luggage and securely store it. We returned at 2:00 and found that our room was not only upgraded but we were sent to the penthouse with the veranda! The location was perfect for our ventures out for shopping, Broadway shows and general sightseeing. The bar was fun and the service was quick. King size bed was quite comfortable. The bathroom was quite functional and it had a soaking tub that my wife enjoyed! The only negative was that the cordless phone in the room did not work. But we didn't have any problems so the phone was unnecessary! Would DEFINITELY go back to this hotel! And NO I AM NOT A SHOREHAM EMPLOYEE! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: just up and go
Reviews.Content: Had a dinner to attend on one of the busiest weekends of the year in New York and got a great rate at the Shoreham. I was pleasantly surprised with an upgrade to a one bedroom suite. Good sized living room, huge bedroom. Tiny bathroom but had everything I needed. The bed was amazingly comfortable. I did use any of the hotel facilities but they looked good. The only problem was my room, which faced 55th street, was a bit loud. Lots of traffic all night. Otherwise a good value. Friendly young staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money for such an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Michael_M_Moscow
Reviews.Content: Modern lobby and amenities. Free coffee and tea from espresso machine downstairs. Rooms are decent size and even the bathroom in my case was ok. Be careful about the AC machines noize in some rooms though - I had to change my room upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good value (this time)”
Reviews.Author: tmandgs
Reviews.Content: Even tho we are in new york every 5 or 6 months we hadn't stayed at the Shoreham in seven years, largely because we felt we could never find a good rate. Having locked down a great AAA rate for a one-night stay, we took full advantage of what is a really nice little hotel: perfect location for hitting tourist sites and shopping; comfy beds and good service; 24-hr coffee/tea/latte machine that we probably used 6 times in 24 hrs. Yes, the decor is getting tired, and yes, our room was a little noisy (right in front of elevator, so 7-9am was busy) but no more so than other places we've stayed; we took the cheapest room so that was likely a factor. Cable tv kept cutting out but we only had it on for weather so wasn't a big deal to us. If you're going to be spending a lot of time in your room, this may not be the place, but if all you need is a "home base" to pop in and out of so you can refresh yourself and explore the city, it's a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, old TVs and noisy location”
Reviews.Author: MikeRSF
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent business trip and was disappointed by the size and quality of the room. The room had an old Dell(!) tv on the wall that could not be angled, the paint was peeling off it's bezel and the signal was grainy or snowy. Bad customer experience. The room is about 13 by 14 feet (small for the money they are asking) the interior furnishings appear dated and worn. Bed was comfortable. Had a room overlooking W54th St - big mistake. The window glass is thin and not properly insulated. The noise from the street penetrated the room, from hearing a group of people walking and talking to the garbage and delivery trucks throughout the night. During checkout in the morning ( usually the busy time of the day) had only one person behind the counter to handle the guests checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed, Too Bad That's About it”
Reviews.Author: gpizzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel leaves me wondering what business they are in ??? It was apparent to me they are poorly managed. The front desk is actually amazing and clearly places operational convenience over old fashioned good hospitality. We requested consideration for an early arrival when making the reservation, but upon arrival, found no one had even read it. The nice folks behind the desk are friendly..."You guys" check your luggage (Robot Response). "We don't guarantee the room will be ready until 3:00pm". So, we checked our luggage and left to enjoy the city. Arriving back at 3PM, the desk clerk attempted to verify the availability of our assigned room by making calls over a fifties something walkie-talkie. Now we were thinking this looks like a "used car lot." In most hotels this is done out of the site of the guest and much more efficiently. Incidentally, the clerks are not in uniform, open collar shirts looking more like someone you would find in your neighborhood hardware store, not a New York hotel. The clock behind the desk was missing the dials. Then there is the game of who will be offered a glass of champagne or water, but that appeared to be sheer luck, we were not lucky. Now, onto the room a "Superior Plus King” Very spacious two room jr. suite Room 803. The bed is GREAT... LCD's in both the parlor and bedroom and a Bose radio a real plus.... Good recessed lighting. Room appeared to be recently decorated and had some nice features like the milky white glass doors throughout. Pathetic lack of attention to guest conveniences... drawer space, closet space and the worst the bathroom. Although very pleasing to the eye, the bathroom is hardly big enough to breath in. There is no room for even the most modest needs for a guest to shower and dress. My shaving kit had to either placed on the floor or in the nearby bedroom. The rain forest shower head was a welcome find. The carpet is old and worn. The mini bar fridge had no space to keep anything cool. The guest room floor hallway is about half as wide as normally found in hotels leading me to think this building must be an apartment building trying to be a hotel, but failing in most areas. There are nice touches... the complementary new paper in the Sunday New York Times and the coffee/tea station off the lobby. The location is great and an easy walk to Saint Patrick’s, Fifth Avenue Shopping, MoMa, and Rockefeller Center etc. The would be a really great hotel to come to for a one night sleepover after a night at a club or out partying. We are over that phase of life and desire more attention to creature comforts over flash and dash. Just go without expectations and you could possibly enjoy the experience. Good luck.... we may go back if the rate is really great and for one night only. Just one last note, the bellmen can be both good and bad. They can be standing at the hotel front entrance and ignore you, as if you are invisible at times.... and at others, greet and acknowledge you as anyone would display hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwousar
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem of a hotel in the perfect location to enjoy New York City. The room was neat, clean and larger than expected. In fact, upon check-in, the manager upgraded our room to a junior suite. Also, the bar is relaxing with a happy hour daily. In the morning the expresso machine in the lobby was a god send. However there was not a view and of course the bathroom is "tight".

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Clean, Great Location, little bit pretentious”
Reviews.Author: Annette T
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous property, sleek, spotlessly clean, on a great street for proximity to shopping and excellent bars, cafes, restaurants. Check out the Uni Glo flagship store just down the road, fantastic. The staff seemed a little snobby to my friends who were also staying there, I didn't mind them so much. They had purchased on priceline and there were 3 of them, they were given a room with one queen bed and were told they could not get a room with 2 beds for that rate (we moved to the Grand Hyatt the next day and they offered us anything we wanted) anyway, they asked for a roll away and were charged FIFTY dollars for it! For one night! Ripped off. The showers are all white tile, modern and super clean and have 5 shower heads, awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place for years”
Reviews.Author: Elyse1219
Reviews.Content: When I worked in Rock Center, I put my clients up at The Shoreham and they loved it. Then I stayed there and it's been my favorite place ever since. I've lived in NYC my whole life, now in the country and when we go it, we stay here when we can. It's a quiet boutique hotel on 55th Street without all the noise, busy-ness of other hotels catering to corporate clients. They renovated it and it's even better. The rooms are lovely, the beds very comfy and very modern and they allow pets (I've yet to bring my little pup), they have internet, a lovely cafe downstairs. No one bothers you, check is is lovely - you get a glass of champagne or water and it's just enough not to be annoying like the larger hotels. The location is fabulous, near to shopping, museums, 5th Ave. everything. I like quaint small places and this fits the bill. We stay 2 nights a week when we are working in the city during tax season! We also have stayed for romantic getaways and special occasions. Try it, you'll like it!!

Reviews.Title: “A great location for a solo woman travelling to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Italia42
Reviews.Content: Located just off Fifth Ave at 55th St could not be better. I could walk to LIncoln Center, Broadway and had really good restaurants across the street. (il Corso, La Bonne Soupe). My room was spacious and well equiped. I would stay there again in a nano second. The staff was great and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, spacious room, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: EnterprisingBoy
Reviews.Content: The location is great - close to Central Park, steps away from 5th Avenue - very good base for sightseeing and business. I had a very spacious room and it was well furnished with enough space for work. The only problem I had was with noise in the room. As the door opens right next to the bed (no entrance passage / vestibule) even the slightest sounds outside are transmitted into the room. So, when people were walking or talking outside it fed right through. WiFi is included and signal strength is very good in the room. The bar and restaurant are quite good but there are lots of choices in the neighbourhood as well. Staff are friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SaraRWD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right smack in the middle of the 5th avenue shopping district and close to central park. If that is the purpose of your visit, it is an excellent place to be located. It is larger "boutique" hotel, so the room sizes can vary greatly. This is my corporation's preferred hotel so I tend to stay there a few times a year, and on this particular occasion I was upgraded to a spa suite. It was well sized, and nicely apportioned with a triple head shower (heavenly) and large jetted tub. It had a separate seating area, although the new age couch was not the most comfortable seating. it seemed like it was meant to be flattened to a futon. The large king size bed was very comfortable. This is one of those places that offers you a glass of champagne or water when you walk in, and I always love that when I check in after work. The fitness center is surprisingly large for this type of hotel, although you're so close to the park, its hard to justify using it, unless the weather is really bad. Overall, I like staying here and would do so more often if it was more convenient to my office.

Reviews.Title: “misrepresentation”
Reviews.Author: shelli c
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THE SHOREHAM!! booked a deluxe luxury queen for 455/night + tax, 3 nights. room had a double bed. we complained 3 separate times. they said it would do no good to change rooms cuz all the "queens" are the same. did not sleep for 3 nights. NOT VERY CONSIDERATE OR SERVICE ORIENTED! night before we are leaving they sent a note admitting we were sleeping in a double bed--so they would take $100 off the entire bill. not acceptable!! if we had known it was a double we would never have booked at this hotel! went on line to look up room rates at the Shoreham for a double bed room. they do not list doubles as an option, only queens and kings. BE WARNED!!

Reviews.Title: “Room filled with gnats”
Reviews.Author: ktw9858
Reviews.Content: The 4th Floor hallway and our room were filled with gnats. The hotel sent up a welcome fruit plate I took the top off an hour later and it was filled with bugs. My roommate and I both took the gnas home. The rooms ar also worn down-town sheets, stains on furniture, carpet needs to go...

Reviews.Title: “Not so special.”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: I didn't think it was that great. Guys at front desk were a little snotty. The room they gave us was in a really weird part of the building-- a floor below the lobby (aka technically the basement) with a view that looked out at the rooftop of the building next door, and all the debris on that rooftop. Maybe if you get to go "upstairs" it's a fabulous experience, but come on-- our money is all the same color green. There were some pretty accents and decorating details to the room, but for the money, and for the feeling that the front desk staff communicated of "you're lucky to be at this hotel, that's the only room we have left, sorry sucker" I would never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, great staff”
Reviews.Author: kmpayea
Reviews.Content: Had to spend the night in the neighborhood for work. Couldn't get a room at the host hotel, so tried a few smaller places. Lucked out with a good rate and thought I'd try the Shoreham. Was tremendously pleased. Efficient. compact.smart. stylish. maybe it was the champagne on checkin that helped me relax. Lovely staff - both on checkin and out - and during minor work emergency that they handled without a blink. wish I could have stayed longer to relax, but alas, back to work the next day. thanks gang - will definitely be back. As for room details: Bath a little outdated (just slightly), short supply on toiletries. bedding was lovely. TV, roomservice, wifi, all worked out great for me. thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Shoreham Above Average”
Reviews.Author: FSUTracey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I vacationed in New York from Oct 20-23rd and stayed at the Shoreham Hotel. The location was excellent, just blocks from Times Square, Central Park and the subway station. The staff was very friendly upon arrival, offering a free glass of champagne upon check-in. There was also complimentary cappuccino, expresso and coffee 24/7. The elevators are very small and can hardly fit two people and luggage. We were upgraded to an executive queen room, which was an adequate sized room. The room lacked a dresser and was dimly lit. The bathroom was tiny, but we expected this in Manhattan. Towels were replaced daily, as well as toiletries. Also, the bed was very comfortable. Our room was on the 8th floor near the back. We really didn't have any street noise. We would definitely stay at the Shoreham again. We were skeptical, but after the trip we agreed that the hotel and its location was exactly what we were hoping for. J & T Pritchard

Reviews.Title: “Big modern room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ladeelawyer
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed with champagne. A machine was available free 24/7 for espresso, cappucino, latte, and coffee, reg or decaf; teas, and hot chocolate. Nice touches for a nicely renovated modern feel hotel. Our room was very large with a very comfortable king bed, flat screen tv (limited channel selection), desk, and very very unusual good lighting. The bath was small, but this was totally offset by the awesome shower. It had the usual overhead spray, but also four others that were adjustable for direction and intensity. Best of all you could adjust water to very hot, afeature so many hotels simply do not have. Our only issue was room temp, which was too warm. It is possible we could have adjusted the a/c, but we opened the window instead, so I don't know if the a/c would have solved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “What a Treasure”
Reviews.Author: laddiem
Reviews.Content: My adult nieces and myself were on a first time trip to Wonderful New York city and stayed at this boutique hotel. I had prepared them not to expect too much as I have heard that NYC hotels can be very small and sometimes lacking in service.We had a deluxe queen size room and were absolutely delighted. The staff was friendly and courteous and could not do enough to make sure we enjoyed our experience. The rooms were clean and well stocked with towels etc and were meticulously maintained. There was always someone in the lobby and coffee are cleaning and wiping down computer chairs etc. The beds were so comfortable that we all had a good night's sleep. The decor was so sleek and different from any other hotel rooms I had visited. All in all, a truly wonderful experience and we would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “doesn't deliver all it promises”
Reviews.Author: lturnbl
Reviews.Content: Whilst we really enjoyed our stay at the shoreham, all the amenities that were promised were not delivered, such as no sparkling wine offered on arrival, bathrobes were provided when we asked for them, fresh flowers, daily newspapers were available at reception but not provided to each room, aveda toiletries were only replenished twice during our 8 night stay. We didn't want to spend our holiday constantly asking for these items that were supposed to be provided but it would have been nice if thay had kept up their promises.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly Designed & Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaiaB
Reviews.Content: I booked the Shoreham for one night at a discount rate of $380. For midtown in October this was reasonable, but I feel sorry for anyone who paid above that rate for their small, poorly designed room. It began with an un-friendly lengthy check in, no doorman, no offer of help with luggage, and the maze-like lobby. I arrived at one p.m. and hoped that, given their 3pm check in time, my room might be ready a bit early. Understandably it wasn't, so I asked about their business center as I had an important call to place that afternoon before the room would be ready. The front desk noted that the business center - if two small computers placed in a nook of the lobby can be called that - was open but probably not a good spot to make a call. They directed me to the restaurant. Fortunately, the restaurant staff were very hospitable to my presence and even reminded me before the kitchen closed in case I wanted lunch. I asked a couple of times about my room, just in case, but evidently they are very strict about 3pm. For a small, "boutique" hotel, I would have expected a bit more leniency on this. For example, I've stayed at many other small boutique hotels where I have been able to check in as early as 11am in the city. I had booked a Deluuxe Luxury Queen, not the cheapest room in the place, but I was very surprised to see that there was no desk present in the room. Since I was traveling on business, I had to work from the superfluous massage chair which they placed in space that would have been much more useful for a desk! Also, the tiny ironing board was broken and barely big enough to iron a shirt on. And, since there was no desk to place the ironing board on (it was not a stand alone), I had to iron on my bed which was interesting to say the least. Add this to a lack of hooks in the room, lack of towel bars in the bathroom, and an overall tired room (frayed carpets, etc) and the whole hotel just felt poorly designed and in need of renovation. Despite the good location and relatively affordable price, this hotel's inattention to many different aspects of the traveler experience means that I won't be staying here again and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean But Small”
Reviews.Author: ErinnBrett
Reviews.Content: We spend Labor Day weekend in NYC 2011 and stayed at The Shoreham. I made the reservation on priceline and got a decent price, I think it was like 250 per night. However, the hotel is sort of cut-up and the room was so small my husband and I could hardly stand in the room at one time. I know its NYC and I know its a boutique hotel but seriously. The bathroom was fairly large, the room area was mostly the bed and we had no where to sit because we had to put our luggage on the ottoman. The hotel was clean and did not have bedbugs. Good location too!

Reviews.Title: “Shoreham Hotel NY an unpleasant and overpriced hotel. Avoid at all cost.”
Reviews.Author: Bryant28
Reviews.Content: If you like antiquated mechanicals (an air conditioner that blows directly on your bed, but can't be adjusted), a bathroom devoid of towels and toiletries, linens that are not changed once during a four night stay, window shades that can not be raised as to provide an outside view, a sofa that was new when Thomas Edison was in diapers and a housekeeping crew that refuses to answer the telephone, then this is the hotel for you. On the bright side, the hotel engineer (whom guests should never have to meet) was excellent, as well as the hotel location and surrounding neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful small hotel- friendly helpful staff - great value”
Reviews.Author: ldm010
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is tucked away on the north side of 55th street - steps away from everything you would want to see, shop and enjoy in Midtown. The rooms on each floor ending in 2 (502, 602, 702, 802 etc - are 2 room suites - living room & bedroom - and face the street. You'll have windows and space - but also street noise. The beds are wonderful - and everything is spotlessly clean. Just realize that space is a premium - the bathroom and closet are tiny. The food is surprisingly good - we enjoyed the ground floor restaurant much. Across the street is also a delightful "authentic" french "brasserie" - La Bonne Soupe - - also highly recommended for lunch or dinner. Given that you are in a very expensive district - hotel wise and in every sense - this hotel is an incredible find ! Rates vary wildly by what is (or isn't) going on elsewhere in town - so if you are concerned - you might want to give them a call to discuss pricing - and consider moving your trip just a few days ahead or back for a surprising difference... The hotel staff is delightful and very interested in accommodating any question or request. Don't hesitate to ask for advice or recommendations. We did find the AC/Fan to be loud - simply not accustomed to the noise - so we turned it off the first night - but found the room got a bit stuffy - sinus kicked in - so the second night we left off the unit in our bedroom - but turned on the unit in the "living room" - with the bedroom door opened - voila - the "white noise" of the fan drowned out the street noise and sirens etc we weren't accustomed to - and the amount of moving air was just great - - a perfect night of sleep ! When we return to NYC - this will be our hotel of choice without question !!!! Computers are available in the lobby - just outside the elevator doors - - thus incredibly accessible. A wonderful value without any pretense.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: scrsteve27
Reviews.Content: The area is superb, all the tourist attractions are close by. We were upgraded to a two roomed suite, the suite was lovely with a massage chair, nice furniture. The air conditioner was noisy, however, after being in the room for awhile you do not notice it, and it does hide the traffic noise outside. I am a light sleeper, but honestly this is not a big problem. You are welcomed with a complimentary glass of champagne. There are plenty of seating areas for guests, well maintained and clean. A lovely touch was having a coffee machine for guests use throughout the day.. (free) Internet was complimentary and staff were very friendly and quick to sort out any requests. One small gripe was that after the first day there was no shower /bath gel left in the bathroom. The value was superb for such a central upbeat, clean modern hotel. Rooms are a good size. Looking forward to returning there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: alexxxita
Reviews.Content: I enjoy hotels that offer compact rooms but luscious duvet and design decors. This is what this hotel offers. So the rooms are small but they have a great beds and a very nice bathroom. I slept like a baby since our room was not facing the street and there was no noise at all. I recommend it. Located in the more commercial and touristic area but still very convenient. I wanted to stay there again but was never able to find a room at less than 250$ after the time I visited. The breakfast was also so expensive we never ate at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - so say the least...”
Reviews.Author: aqua2011
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Shoreham for 4 nights, last not least after reading the Tripadvisor references. I staid for 1 night and left as early as I could the next morning. The location is good, no doubt, but their as lots of great Hotels in that area and within walking distance, that offer much more value for money. I spent over $$ 500 for one night for what they call a "Deluxe One Bedroom Suite". The "Suite" is furnished with very basic furniture, that has bee around for a long time.. The upholstry on some of the elemets and the massage chair was worn and torn. The wallwpaper on some walls was rotten in some places as if it had suffered prvious humidit. The bed was fine. The bathroom extremely small and basic - $ 50 Motel type bathroom - and definitely not fit for a $500 Hotel. The air conditioning units are totally outdated and loud. The windows are old and insufficient. No isolation whatsoever. The lobby area is very small and dark. The elevators hardly accommodate one man with one suitcase. The elevators are dirty. The carpets in public ares are filthy. Yes, the staff is friendly. Yes they have a coffee machine on the ground floor. But when I was there it did not work...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AQ737
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at The Shoreham. Great location for a reasonable price. Room was comfortable and free internet is rare these days. Hotel is relatively small, so you don't have to walk a mile from the elevator to outside. Staff was very helpful recommending restaurants and getting a town car to the airport. The air conditioning units were a little noisy and I tried to turn it off while sleeping, but the fan still runs.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location, will return!”
Reviews.Author: hleen
Reviews.Content: Contemporary hotel, helpful, kind staff. Very clean and comfortable. We stayed in a Jr. spa suite, plenty of space for 1 adult and 2 teens. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect, staff was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Proud2Love3
Reviews.Content: I had booked a trip to New York for my partner for her birthday present as she has always said she wanted to go there, after they passed the marriage law 2 months prior to our arrival we decided to get hitched as well! I sent a email to the general reservations at The Shoreham and they had the warmest response that was very genuine, so right off the bat it was a great impression. Upon arrival we were greeted by the nicest front desk agent, Sorin he was the sweetest guy ever. He welcomed us as if we were old friends, he greeted us with a glass of champagne and congratulated us on all of the things we were celebrating while in New York. Once we got to our room we couldn’t have been more happy, it was so quiet and cute. The tub was wonderful and bed could not have been better! Yes the rooms are small, but its New York and you really should just be in it to sleep and soak in the tub, however it did feel like a nice escape from the city when we did retreat to our room. We will always come back year after year to celebrate our Anniversary, it was the best trip ever and the Shoreham was a huge part of it. I cannot thank the staff enough (especially Sorin) for all of their help in making this the most special of stays.-Rachael S.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and wouldn't go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Sarge931
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Shoreham in 2006 and have gone back to stay each time we visit NYC. It's the only hotel where we will stay. The hotel is very modern and clean; the rooms are very clean. Everything is spotless and neat. The hotel offers complimentary champagne upon arrival and also has a coffee dispenser in the lobby. You can use this maker yourself and can choose from regular or decaf coffee, espresso, latte, or cappuccino and you can even hear the beans being grinded while waiting for your drink to dispense. Rooms offer either a queen or king bed with a massaging chair, flat 32" tv, and a marble bath. The location is close to Central Park, Broadway, and some good restaurants. It's very quiet and you can easily relax either in your room or hotel lounge area. The hotel restaurant/bar offers 1/2 wines from 8:00 to 10:00 PM and has live entertainment. Once you experience this boutique hotel you'll not want to go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good, but getting an upgraded room is worth the money”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: Overall pleased with this hotel. I have stayed here twice, once in Aug 2010 and once in Aug 2011, and both stays were for 3 nights. Both stays were for a shopping trip with my girlfriend. Check in is efficient and friendly. Valet helped with my luggage upon check in and check out. For my last stay, we had room 805 - a single queen room. The room was right outside the elevator, and a little noisy (can hear everything going on in the hall), so I wouldn't get this room again (I'm a pretty light sleeper). Also, I think it is a little too small for 2 girls with lots of luggage. The bathroom was relatively spacious for the size of the room. The drain in the shower/tub was a little clogged up, otherwise no issues. The biggest issue with this room was really the temperature -- the room didn't cool down very well The A/C which was on full blast. It took about 4 hours to get the room to an idea temperature (the temp outside was in the 80s). The first night of our stay, I was up throughout the night sweating until the room finally cooled off. Last year, we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. For the price, I would definitely book a 2 bedroom suite next time i stay- well worth the extra money. It felt spacious, was quiet and there were no issues with the temperature in the room. Like all the reviews say, this room is in a great location. Bloomie Nails (across the street) does a good job if you need a mani/pedi without an appointment. Also if you are a shopper, this is right in the middle of all the action - Saks, BG, Neimans, Barneys etc etc all within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Dovhoz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in a package deal thru a major online travel website and it was a steal. The location was the primary reason for choosing it, but after staying here, I certainly would look to visiting here again. The decor is very metro and cool. While the rooms are small (it's New York yah know!) the bath room was extra roomy and 2 people could get ready at the same time with ease. The bed was great and we loved the the choice of fabrics used in our room and throughout the hotel. I especially enjoyed sitting in 1 of their 2 bars with the floor to ceiling windows opening onto the streets. The locals flock there for their cocktail lounge and great DJ's. The staff was courteous and helpful with questions we had and even offered suggestions which is a plus! Their location was great access to shopping on 5th Ave, The Ed Sullivan theatre if you're lucky enough to have tix to Dave Letterman and just right around the corner from Central Park! Can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fad3449
Reviews.Content: Great location for this modern hotel. The room was small but your in the middle of downtown Manhattan, you don't need to be in the room for long. Within 2 blocks of Central Park and right around the corner from the NY Apple Store and CBS News building. There's an Irish/sports bar in the same block as well as several other good restaurants. You stay on the block and never want for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Beachman727
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here probably 5+ times but haven't gotten around to reviewing it until now. The Shoreham is our hotel of choice in NYC for business due to it's location and boutique feel. A tip though is try and do anything possible to get at least one room upgrade from the basic room, since the basic room is very small particularly for a couple. Realizing that many rooms in NYC are small and generally expensive, if your stay here is going to be that big NYC trip you've been waiting for - spend the extra money on a room upgrade. Sometimes I have gotten the basic room, and a few times I've been upgraded and I can tell you I have much enjoyed this place with the upgraded junior 1 bedroom suite. The rooms are pretty spartan but tasteful. Some of the upgraded rooms have massage chairs which is well appreciated after a day of meetings or walking around NYC. I haven't experienced the noise issue from the fans, or the noisy hallways but almost all hotels have big heavy doors for fire blocks - they aren't that good for soundproofing so you are going to hear the hallway everywhere. NYC is active 24 hours a day so you're going to hear street noise all the time - since they do a lot of construction and streetwork at night, and the garbage trucks are always active at night. If you're a light sleeper bring earplugs - for anywhere in NYC not just this hotel The bathroom situation as described in other posts is confirmed - the basic rooms have a decent size bathroom (i.e. you can walk in and around) but really small room. The upgraded rooms (at least one or two levels above a basic) have a really small bathroom - like you can step in and brush your teeth with the back of your leg hitting the toilet. So keep that in mind. You are going to get this pretty much anywhere in New York so if you are used to space, be prepared and appreciate it when you stay in a place that isn't so crammed with people. There is a designer lobby bar which is a good place to get a drink before going out, and doubles for the breakfast option. But keep in mind you have so many other options nearby - you don't have to pay the big dollars for hotel food and drink if you don't want to. Your location is great for proximity to shopping, subways and Central Park. Another tip for some reviews I read from people who try and check in early and then get miffed the room isn't ready at like 1pm - are usually the people who want the late checkout and then don't understand why the hotel can't clean 200 rooms in like 90 minutes. I often arrive well before the usual 3 or 4pm checkin time and usually phrase my discussion with the front desk as "i know i'm early but just wondering if by chance the room might be ready..." and am nice about realizing they really aren't under any obligation to have the room ready. I'd say they find me a room about 75% of the time. The Shoreham will call your mobile when the room is ready if you do arrive early and they don't have anything yet, although many times they find me a room they've already turned over. Sometimes the room rate even for the basic room can hit close to $300-400 depending on occupancy and time of year - so for the people that get online deals or special offers in the $150 range, that is pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandie1947
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival and departure, the front door was opened for us. At check in we were offered a glass of champagne or water in a wine glass. Very nice. The lobby is refreshing and there is plenty of comfortable seating. Our room was spacious for a boutique hotel and the bathroom was plenty large enough. The bedroom had a desk/counter, bench seating and another comfortable chair. The air-conditioner was functioning well. There is a separate room in the lobby area where you can help yourself to coffee, espresso or teas. A very nice touch. Truly...if you spend too much time in your room in NYC, you are not enjoying the city life. The price was right (approx. $154/night) and it is centrally located to many sights in the city and only a few blocks from Central Park. I would return to The Shoreham and highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC. My only complaint would be that the elevator button wasn't working well and would often pass our floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: drummer724
Reviews.Content: We just got back from four days in NY with our family (2 kids ....14 and 12). This is a contemporary boutique hotel in a fabulous location! The hotel was clean and the staff was courteous, professional and prompt with requests! Our room set up was ideal for a family of 4......it had two separate bedrooms with a small a tv area in between them which included a desk area. Each bedroom had flat screen tvs, comfortable beds with soft sheets! The bathroom was large with nice fixtures. The only problem was the small sink and lack of counter space. The complimentary coffee, espresso, cappuccino machine located in the lobby, was a nice plus! We used it every morning and evening.....better then those small dinky coffee makers that are usual found in hotel rooms. Look forward to returning to this hotel when we return to Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, however.......”
Reviews.Author: TravelFanRC
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on a quiet block. Liked the modern lobby and the champagne check in was a very nice touch. The room was cozy with plenty of storage space. Nice bathroom with a great shower. The only two negative things I can say about the Shoreham is, the A/C was not that great. Both me and my friends who were in the next room could barely get the room cool. Also, if you like to sleep in, the Shoreham is not for you. You could hear every single sound in the hallway. And people started getting up and leaving their rooms as early as 7:00 AM. The hallway noise was SO clear it was almost like we didn't have a door on our room. Our friends next door said the same. So bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: 2vaca
Reviews.Content: We (3 ladies) stayed her in the two bedroom apartment. It was NYC size - smallish. However, the appointments were lovely, and it was spotless. There is one bathroom with a shower (nice one) and a separate tub/shower. There are three rooms : 2 bedroom and one small livingroom with a sofa bed. All three rooms had large flat screen televisions. Some nice amenities were the Aveda products, free wifi, nice free coffee bar, and champagne at check in. The front desk was very helpful and gave us good advice regarding places to eat and hired cars vs cabs. Actually, the front desk was one of the things that made it such a nice stay. Everyone had a good sense of humor and were accomodating. We had breakfast one morning there, and it was good but expensive. After that we went to Duncan Donuts two doors down from the hotel. The only negative we had was the world's tiniest closet. There was one closet for the entire apartment. We managed and had a grand time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: highjul
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel twice for business, and both times I've enjoyed my stay. The service has been great, and the rooms have been clean and spacious. The beds are very comfortable, and everything in the room is updated. On the negative side, in my first room, the bathroom was absolutely tiny. It was poor planning, in that the room was HUGE otherwise (a bedroom plus a living room, with tons of floor space). When I say tiny, I mean there was literally no room to move in the bathroom. My second room, however, had a huge bathroom, with a smaller living space, which I much preferred. The rooms both had massage chairs, which were great! One of the rooms overlooking the street was very loud. The windows must not be very sound proof, because I was awoken by the trashmen in the middle of the night. I would definitely recommend this -- a great value for a NYC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: travel9873
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews here, I was concerned that the room would be tiny and the lobby grungy. Neither was the case. The Shoreham was clean, with avant-garde decor and nice amenities. I thought the room (two double beds) was perfectly fine size-wise; unlike most Manhattan hotels I've stayed in, you didn't have to cram your luggage next to your bed and climb over it to get anywhere. The bathroom was small but perfectly adequate. Our room was near the elevator and we did hear some pinging, but it wasn't bad at all. We weren't facing the street so there was very little other noise--amazing for Manhattan! The wifi was no-hassle and worked well, which is important for me. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We liked the little coffee-tea stand where we could get free hot drinks in the lobby. Note: Be careful getting out of the elevator on the ground floor because there's a door right nearby that swings open and could hit you. Given how pricey Manhattan hotels are, I thought this hotel offered decent value. And you could hardly beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solegirl73
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal online, and I had zero expectations of this place. The staff was surprisingly friendly (this is a boutique hotel in Midtown, right?!) and accomodating. Alexis at the front desk left an impression with me. She was very friendly and accomodating to all of our needs at check-in. The rest of the staff at this hotel, from the doorman to the housekeepers, were also friendly and accomodating. Many rooms (including bathrooms) in NYC are small, but I found the layout to be very smart. I also loved the massage chair in the room! After a long day of schlepping around the city, this was a fantastic end to my day! The 24 hour complimentary coffee, espresso, capuccino, latte, and hot tea don't hurt either. I would definitely stay here again. Very nice place conveniently located to everywhere I needed to go.

Reviews.Title: “The noise due to AC machines is a big problem in some rooms”
Reviews.Author: SabadellFrancesc
Reviews.Content: Important comment about noise. We have booked a Executive Queen double room for 10 days. The first room asigned on the 10th floor was so noisy because most of air conditioned central compresors are placed in the internal open gallery where one of the room windows is looking to. The noise is permanent. The staff proposed us to moove to lower floor but the noise problem was exactly the same as the room was facing the same internal open gallery. Finally the staff proposed us a unique solution: move to a Deluxe Suite room facing the street with an extra cost of 50 $ per day !; In this case the noise was acceptable as usual City noise; it was not the Hotel noise from the previous rooms proposed. Staff attitude has not been comprehensive at all in this evident situation. We were forced to accept it only to avoid the problems of an unexpected hotel change in NY. We did not need a bigger and more expensive room as we stay in the Hotel only in night hours. Let me say that the Shoreham senitivity regarding noise is not apropiated. We did not need to use air conditioned in the room because of the season but room AC machines are also too noisy. Second example: in the entrance to the hotel, right side in the street facing the door, you can hear an air compressed ecape high noise coming from the store under the loby level; it has been there all 10 days we stayed there; in adittion to the high noise, it is also a high extra cost to whom has to pay the air compressed bill. You can probabily chek it if you go there today. F & MJ.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique plus”
Reviews.Author: wxyzee
Reviews.Content: I hate the feeling of big chain hotels so the Shoreham was the perfect alternative. We stayed in a king deluxe room on the penthouse floor (10th) which had the most amazing feature, a terrace with lounge chairs. It provided a terrific view of the city and a great place to relax and have a glass of wine. You cannot argue with the location, halfway between 5th and 6th Avenues, close to all the subways lines, a five minute walk to Central Park and a 5 Guys burger joint next door. The free coffee, espresso and tea machine as well as free internet were terrific touches. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Just not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: CHASEYMYAABBY
Reviews.Content: We booked the junior spa suite at the hotel and when we arrived I was extremely disappointed. The room was so small and dark it felt claustrophobic. I was suprised they could call this a suite. We immediately called about an upgrade to the next largest room which was a one bedroom suite. They were able to accomodate us and upgraded us to the one bedroom suite for an additional charge of course. The one bedroom suite was very nice and much brighter because it faced 55th street rather than just a wall. The room itself was nice, but the bathroom was ridiculously small. We had three people in the room and the bathroom situation was just plain bad. Other than the bathroom though the room was very spacious and comfortable. I dont know that I would book this hotel again unless they had a similar one bedroom suite with a MUCH larger bathroom. Also, we were on the third floor and the noise from the streets kept me up all night. I finally had to go and get some earplugs as I didint sleep the entire first night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: sued80
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to NQR and F subway lines. Rooms clean, comfortable Free tea/coffee/hot chocolate machine in lobby was nice Got a good deal online so was great value for money for a trendy hotel. Would definately stay again if price right. Also there is a fantastic cheap & authentic little japanese restaurant next door with great food!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Needs staff who have customer service skills though!”
Reviews.Author: DC604
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend we were getting married. Prior to our arrival, I had emailed the manager of the hotel asking him to please PLEASE let us check in early as we had lots to do in preparation for our wedding the next day. No reply to my email. Upon arriving at the Shoreham at 1, I was greeted by a woman who wasnt so friendly and when I asked about early check in, and her reply was to show me a stack of papers and say, "All these people have tried to check in before you. Your room is guaranteed for 3 pm." (After that I had already begun mentally writing this review based on the poor first impression) We left our bags and wandered around and my husband got a call at 245 advising us our room was ready. (GEE THANKS!) Hotel itself is fine. Modern and boutique, rooms were good, location is close to subway stops. Bathroom was clean. Excellent shower. Elevator very tiny (2 ppl plus suitcases) Overall, my issue was with the service here. No one ever spoke to us from check in until check out. Neither time were the front desk clerks friendly. If service matters, pay a little more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Midtown Manhattan but not so great for families unless you book well in advance.”
Reviews.Author: golfcaddie99
Reviews.Content: The Shoreham hotel is a boutique hotel in a great midtown location. Upon check-in you are offered a glass of champagne or a glass of bottled water. I chose to just "check-in" and forgo the offer - didn't know how long the champagne had been opened or the designer water bottle. Would have been better to just let you have a water out of the mini-bar for free. They do have bell service if you ask. The elevators are like other smaller hotels in NYC. They are tiny! So if you're carrying a lot of luggage, seek help. Or you will have to make two/three trips. Cab fare to this location from LaGuardia was 29.00 including tolls and tip. We had three people in my group with checked luggage so we had a trunk full of bags. We had to upgrade to a Jr. suite to accommodate two adults and one teenager due to no basic rooms with two beds. Something I will discuss later in my review. The room was small to be called a "Jr. Suite" even compared to other hotels I've stayed at in midtown at the same price. The bathroom was standard and the "jacuzzi" tub did not work. So the only upgrade we received for 100.00 more a night was a European sofa so our teenager would have a place to sleep. This hotel is a great choice for the couple seeking midtown location to stay for leisure. Business travelers would also benefit by this location with business in the midtown area. Close to subway stations and it is located on west 55th between 5th and 6th avenues. So you're close to Central park, Madison Ave. shopping, times square and theater district. Now for my story about how this hotel was chosen. I didn't contact the hotel directly for reservations. I used priceline (sorry TripAdvisor!) and was awarded a price of $235.00 per night at this location. Because priceline states that the price includes only 2 adults - I contacted the hotel directly to secure a room with two beds. Of course they didn't have any basic rooms with two beds at the price I bid through Priceline. So I was pretty much a hostage of using the hotel and was forced to pay an extra 100.00 per night for a sofa. Priceline would not help me in any way. Needless to say this is the first and last time I will use Priceline, Net result is that I don't know if the hotel took advantage of my situation or whether they were full. The front desk acted like they couldn't understand English. At this point I really had no choice but to pay for the upgrade. So even though my experience with this hotel started out badly, I still would probably stay at the Shoreham again if I were traveling alone or traveling with my spouse. Unless you book directly with the hotel and secure the necessary bedding, I would not recommend this hotel for families. During this trip we only ate breakfast at the on-site hotel. Breakfast for three people was $60 US. They offer a continental menu option but with tip it would still be $16-$20 US per person. Sorry to say we did not try any other meals at the hotel. The breakfast choices we made were good. Service was ok. But I think the service staff and kitchen staff were having a bad morning the day we dined. Overall I rated this hotel average because I've stayed at other hotels in midtown and had more room for same or less cost per night. The only selling point of this hotel is the location in my opinion if you want to or must stay in midtown. The boutique aspects of the hotel were nice but they are due to update the property. I rated the value of this hotel low due to the size of the room vs the price charged.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlie_nl
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend in Ny - and stayed at this nice hotel. Perfect location close to 5th ave, and loads of small shops, restaurants around. Easy walking distance to more of less all of manhattan. Staff friendly and helpful. Would love to go back

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, staff, and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: SarahSmile1981
Reviews.Content: I just took my first trip to NYC and stayed at the Shoreham. It was amazing! The location is perfect, we felt so safe and so close to everything, just a short walk to bars, restaurants, central park, etc. The lobby is very cool, has a very boutique feel. We were greeted warmly and given a glass of champagne while we checked in. The bar is a fun, colorful place with nice big windows along the street, great for people watching. The rooms are a very decent size and very clean and fun; Bose radio, tile shower, flat screen t.v. on the wall, interesting light up headboard, big windows. The whole place just really felt unique and nice. The staff were amazing. Very nice and helpful. The man who got our bags out of our room while we were checking out was especially nice, we cut our schedule too close and he helped us get out quickly and into our vehicle. I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “used to be my new york home, but”
Reviews.Author: suiren
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here was about 15 years ago, it was a new boutique hotel opened in an idea location. I stayed also in 2004 and 2007, so it gradually became my New York home while I have been tried some other hotels. However, from my recent experiences I found that the hotel becomes to be disappointing level, for its service quality. Of all, the cleaning ladies were hanging around the small corridor speaking loudly and this does not make you relaxing in the morning till afternoon. I think I have to find another home now even though the location is still great with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “used to be a good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Bibithepoop
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Shoreham on several occasions over the last 10 years.
