Despite being urged by trustworthy sources that standards had dropped precipitously over the couple of years at the hotel, I decided recently to give it a shot anyways. I should have heeded the advice... No doorman, no help with our luggage (no offer), very slow check-in with a booking mistake (not mine, mind you) that was badly fumbled by the young staff (well, my age - 30s), no umbrellas, lounge closed to hotel patrons in the afternoon, no customary offer of a welcoming drink - and all of this in the first 15 minutes. The room (we stayed in a "Spa Suite") was tired and small. Very worn carpets, dull furnishings, small bathroom (actually just poorly designed - with a huge shower and tub, tiny vanity and no space to put your things). Televisions (not so important to me anyway) with exceptionally poor video quality. Positives: the rooms are clean and bedbug free. 55 & 5 is a great location. But for the money, and the 4-star "boutique" hotel rating, you could (and had you, like I, stayed here previously) would expect a lot more. The inattentive service began during my booking on the phone and never improved. I requested 2 things: 1. a quiet room on the inside (remembering from a previous visit that the garbage collection on 55w begins loudly at 5:30am and 2. a room that was not hot or at least had a thermostat (also after prior experience). We received a very hot and moderately noisy room booked under the wrong name. Perfect....

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, found our room to be clean and confortable”
Reviews.Author: kidmoan
Reviews.Content: Just back from a recent stay in The Shoreham over Thanksgiving. The reception staff were friendly and efficient as were all of the other staff we encountered. Our party had booked two rooms (714 & 716) and they were both very clean and in my opinion of a good size (certainly based on hotels in the UK!). One room had a street view and the other a view of the fire escape! However, as we were in New York the views were not an issue for us as most of our time was going to be spent exploring. Overall we had a very good stay at the shoreham and would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “SCARY, UNBELIEVABLY REPUGNANT, POOR VALUE!!”
Reviews.Author: JMS84
Reviews.Content: This "boutique " hotel on West 55 St near 5th Avenue, while reasonably priced depending on the time of year one visits New York, is a joke. I t has a scary tenement style entrance with practically no lobby, with a maze like ground floor where you have problems finding the elevators before which you pass a "trendy", if you want to call it that, cocktail lounge. The rooms are repugnant and not very clean, extremely small and you have to navigate with your partner/spouse to move around the room (needless to say no room for the luggage). The "renovated" construction of the rooms is very poor, the door to the bathroom does not close entirely. It appears that any renovation was built upon former existing fixtures, covered over to appear to be more modern.The elevators are dark(probably to hide the dirt), . It short, it's a depressing place which does not add to an enjoyable stay even in a very good location. At the bargain price per day which I had obtained , $255 with tax, it is poor, poor value. It's designed from my point of view to squeeze the client and subject him/her to living in almost tenement conditions while attempting to give the false impression that one is staying in a "cool" hotel. Some people will like it so long as it is cool and in a good location, but I would be embarassed to invitie New York friends to visit me or pick me up at this hotel. Caveat emptor!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny & Tired”
Reviews.Author: AlltheFun
Reviews.Content: Our miniture, dated room did not ruin a much needed three day trip to celebrate my birthday. Boutique sized hotel rooms are fine if you know about it going in. This room was small and you wouldn't know it by the rate. I saw a guest checking in with 4 pieces of luggage and laughed at the thought of navigating through her room!! The room was also in dire need of a renovation. The location was great but for the money I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Could have done better....”
Reviews.Author: mikecurl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, then decided to change hotels and glad I did. Starting with the positives, the location was very good and the reservation process was very efficient. The things I didn't reall like were: - $17 continental breakfast was really poor.. Best Western do a better breakfast and it's included! - The room was small and pretty grubby. - The bathroom was very industrial - metal sinks etc. Might be your cup of tea but not mine - A few of things were broken and maintenance lacked attention to detail (coak hook, toilet seat didn't stay up, heating control would only do cold not hot etc) If I was only paying $150 a night I wouldn't be as fussy, but having paid over $300 per night, I expected a lot better. Have moved down to the Eventi on a similar rate and it's so much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, staff and amentities.”
Reviews.Author: uktomiami
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long 4 day weekend with my partner and also my parents (in another room!) for a family wedding. The hotel is perfect for sightseeing, shopping and eating out, plus right by the subway. The front desk staff are all extremely helpful and polite, and our rooms, were clean and had everything we needed. I particularly liked the free tea and coffee, which was great to start and end the day with. I actually booked the hotel through a 3rd party site, and got the rooms for half the price the hotel had them for, but they still honored an upgrade for my parents. All in all, a great stay, and I would go back to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Midtown gem”
Reviews.Author: 186338Lisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Shoreham for our first ever visit to New York and we'll definitely tstay there again. The location was perfect. It was near great restaurants, close to the major art galleries, concert halls, Central Park and the subway yet it was surprisingly quiet, especially in the evenings, given its proximity to major thoroughfares. It was also only a couple of blocks away from the subway for the D train which is the line that takes you straight out to the new Yankees baseball stadium within about 25 minutes. And all the staff, from those on the main desk to the porters, the cleaning staff, the bartenders and waiters were simply fantastic. All were genuinely friendly, helpful and polite. We arrived at the hotel considerably later than planned due to delays at the airport and were concerned that perhaps the hotel might have given our rooms away. And because of traffic our taxi couldn’t park right outside the hotel. But as soon as we got our luggage out of the taxi the hotel porter came straight up to greet us in the street and took our luggage into the lobby and then straight up into the room while we checked-in. At the check-in desk we were immediately offered complimentary cold drinks which were life savers as we hadn't had a drink for a few hours and we were very hot and tired by the time we arrived. We stayed in their Junior Spa suite and when we got into the room it was lovely and cool as the air conditioner had been left on in advance of our arrival. The bedroom area was comfortable and the shower room was quite large with great water pressure and super clean with lots of towels. The only thing I missed was one of those extending wall mirrors that has a magnifying lens on one side because I don't have great eyesight and because of the sink I couldn’t get close enough to the main mirror. But there was lots of lighting in the bathroom which was helpful. The air conditioner unit was easy to operate and relatively quiet for an air conditioner – there was a slight hum but it didn’t keep us awake. Before arriving we'd read some reviews which said the decor was a bit tired. And it was as there were a few scuff marks here and there on the skirting boards and the furniture in the lounge area did look a bit worn in places but that didn't bother us. There was plenty of room and it was spotlessly clean. The bed was reasonably firm with nice linen and there was lots of good lighting by the bed. There was no wonderful view as the room but again that wasn't a priority for us. The elevator was big enough for 2 adults and 2 suitcases but no more. The room was also quiet and we didn't hear our neighbours except when they were outside in the corridor. We ate dinner at the hotel a couple of times, on our first and last night, and both times we were impressed with the standard of the cooking and the quality of the food. The bar and waiting staff were great and mixed great cocktails - my husband said his Manhattan was one of the best he'd every had. And as one of bar tenders had just recently finished his doctoral thesis in American history he was very interesting to talk to and a really nice chap. Before arriving we were concerned about tipping especially as we'd heard stories from friends who'd stayed elsewhere who said they always had to have their hands in their pockets ready to tip everyone. But at this hotel the policy is to automatically add on a service charge to say the food or drink bills, which is what we're used to in the UK, which meant we didn't feel obliged to be constantly tipping within the hotel because we knew staff weren't relying on tips to survive. On the ground floor of the hotel there is a lounge area behind the bar/dining area which, when we were there, had a great display featuring all the best 'on trend' clothes, bags and jewellery as picked from Harpers Bazaar magazine. It was closed when we came across it and I only wished I'd discovered it earlier as it would have been nice to have gone in to have a closer look at all everything before hitting the shops. Although I’m not sure if that’s possible but the window display was still pretty slick so you could see lots of very nice things which really wetted the appetite. Security was very good in the hotel - visible but low-key - the staff on the main door remembered us from Day One so we came and went as we liked and we felt very safe all the time we were in the hotel. In fact security in general was pretty high in the whole area because while we were there the UN General Assembly was taking place which meant large numbers of diplomats were in town and staying at nearby hotels. There were teams of police practically on every street corner and police cars were constantly patrolling the area. The only downside was that we couldn't get in to visit the UN at any time during our stay. So if the UN is somewhere you want to see don't visit New York during the last two weeks in September when the UN General Assembly are in session. Another tip is that the hotel has very good complimentary maps and also stocks complimentary copies of Time Out New York magazine. And their 24 hour coffee/tea area is a great amenity too. They have two internet screens in the downstairs lobby which you can use whenever you want and there's a printer which is also free to use. And once you get a password from the main desk you can also access WiFi. We never got to try out their gym but we had a look 'round and the equipment was what we were used to back in the UK and it looked very clean and well lit with lots of mirrors. The hotel also arranged our airport transfers to and from JFK. The cars we both clean and spacious. However, when we arrived we took ages getting through immigration and consequently the driver charged us more than we'd been quoted because of the extra waiting time so bear that in mind if you pre-arrange a taxi pick-up. There seemed to be plenty of taxis at the airport but it was nice to hop into a large air-conditioned car on a hot day. Lastly, like other trip advisors we found that booking direct via the hotel’s website was more expensive than booking via a specialist travel website. We used a site called newyorkcityluxuryhotels.com who were excellent and able to get us the Junior Spa suite for the same price as a standard room at the hotel. All in all we had a great time in New York which was due, in no small part, to staying at The Shoreham. If it were a publicly quoted stock we'd be buyers! My husband is already planning our stay there next year. We hope you find the above information useful. Please bear in mind it was our first stay in New York so we don't have any other New York hotel experience to compare it to but even still we really enjoyed our stay at The Shoreham and hope you do too - the staff really are pretty special here.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel but (with typical for NY) small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: neilthestooge
Reviews.Content: Great service at this hotel and within a few minutes of time square, just incredibly an small room (which was on the 2nd floor so the view was dreadful!). Very clean, modern and trendy place to stay and a great little bar!

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff and consistent quality”
Reviews.Author: LaBu
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this hotel and we found it very satisfactory as our home away from home. After a busy day of museums and shopping, we always looked forward to returning to the hotel for a little rest before the evening's activities. There's a wonderful self-service coffee and tea station near the lobby. The room's decor is soothing and serene. The location in midtown is fantastic. The front desk staff is friendly, helpful and efficient. When we plan a trip to NY, this is always our hotel of choice and we've stayed here many times now.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Speklova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shoreham during a long weekend with a friend. The hotel is well located for shopping and Central Park but not great for going out in the evening. The rooms were good size (compared to NYC standards) and the beds super comfortable. Bathroom was very small but functional. We used the room service for breakfast one morning and other times for ice and cutlery and it was always really quick and friendly. The front desk staff was a bit self important but perfectly efficient. I can't fault this hotel, it's good value for money, perfect for shopping and sightseeing and the rooms are functinal and comfortable. By far the best mid range hotel in NYC I've stayed in. Not luxurious by any means but perfectly comfortable and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “A Clean, Modern, European Boutique Hotel in an Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: LuckyMe78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from NYC, stayed 4 nights, had a great time in the City and The Shoreham. Here are some notes about our stay: ---very modern looking futuristic furniture inside lobby with a large t.v. monitor built into the wall; very low ceilings throughout lobby and lounge: I could touch the ceiling easily and I am 5'9". ---service was good, albeit very business-like; we were able to check in 2 hours early and were offered champagne or Voss sparkling water upon arrival. We chose water because it was so hot and humid. ---The hotel building has two facades: an older one on the East side of the building, a newer one on the West. I had read on Oyster.com that the rooms on the East, older side had higher ceilings and since we chose a basic Superior Queen room anyway, I figured to just request a room on the East side. However, the lady after checking her computer said that those rooms were all booked (even though the hotel inside did not seem to be very busy with a lot of patrons) so instead we were assigned a room on the newer West side of the building--room 911. Of course, I immediately noted the irony when she casually informed us of this, so in response, I said playfully, "oh thats a little disconcerting". She then reassured us that it will be fine, so off we went with our luggage as we declined an offer for the bellhop to bring them up for us. ---The good thing about the West building is that the 2 elevators are much roomier; enough to fit 2 people, 3 carry-ons, and 1 large suitcase. The other elevator on the East side is a phone booth sized lift, which we never needed anyway since we were on the newer West side of the building. ---the elevator ride was pleasant; dimly lit with small colorful club lighting near the ceiling of elevator and good dance music playing, but very quietly; ---the hallways to the rooms are very cramped but its normal for a boutique hotel ---The room itself was surprisingly roomy and very clean! It had a low ceiling mainly due to the design of the room, as the bed's headboard extended across the ceiling, but very modern looking and sleek and new! ---There was in fact, a large window with ample light coming through and a view of the tops of buildings next door and further away, views of much taller buildings which appeared to have housed businesses inside. You could see easily through the window so not much privacy, but there was a shade to pull down plus a curtain so no worries there. ---The bathroom was pleasantly large for a boutique hotel room! A regular sized bathtub with a huge mirror on the wall of the bathtub. Tiny sink but ample vanity space for toiletries around the sink and above the toilet. ---we noticed right when we walked in to the room, the toilet was making flushing noises, so I walked over to it and saw that it kept flushing itself every 3 or 4 seconds. This turned out to be only a minor problem as we quickly called front desk and they sent up a maintenance worker who resolved the issue in 10 minutes. ---In the room, there was some very ingeniously placed lighting, terrific shade of light green color, a good sized closet with a mini safe, a little bar inside the dresser with some snacks for sale, which we never needed, as well as an LCD 32" LG television which had poor reception on a few channels. Again, this didn't bother us since we didn't come to NYC to watch t.v. ---Sleep quality was good although the bed is smaller than a standard queen size bed, the pillows and mattress were terrific. The AC worked most of the time but there was a constant humming of the AC during the night whether it was on or off and we couldn't tell if it was coming from the room or the building next door. Wife had a problem with the noise as she slept with pillows covering her ears, but it didn't bother me much. ---there was a bench at the end of the bed which I promptly moved off to the side to create more space and placed our 1 large suitcase on top. I put one carry-on in the closet on top of the fold-out suitcase holder. I put the other carry-on on top of the window sill and scooted the little circular glassy bedside table over a few inches to give the carry-on more surface area and I still had enough room to place a bottled water on top. ---Curiously, there was no alarm clock and no bath robes in the room although if you were to request bath robes, it would be available. You can just use your cell phone for an alarm as we did or call front desk for a wake-up call. ---the location was great for us! Since we are in our early 30's, we were able to traverse the streets of Manhattan easily and willingly to see many of the exciting attractions the City had to offer. The hotel's block (W. 55th between 5th and 6th) was very busy with your typical hustle and bustle of NYC. There were a few restaurants and bars that were crowded in the evenings. There was a Dunkin Donuts and a Five Guys burger place right next door. The Shoreham's own low-ceilinged lobby bar was crowded only 1 night we were there; a great speaker system throughout lobby and the bar but the volume was kept at a minimum the whole time. They have a great breakfast menu, their Eggs Benedict was delicious albeit around $15. Their continental b-fast was $17 which included cereals, pastries, multi-grain toast and juice. They have a wonderful FREE selection of tea packets, a coffee, espresso, cappuccino machine in a little room off the lobby in which you can take with you on the go which we did each morning even in the searing heat and humidity. ---by the 2 elevators at the end of the lobby, there was on-going construction of a room that was to house "The Willow Club" a private membership club in which The Shoreham as well as other hotels in Manhattan are involved; Luckily however, this construction did not interfere with our stay at all as far as dust and noise level was concerned. --Overall, I would recommend the Shoreham on 3 counts: 1) If you like the positives I stated above and don't mind the negatives (of which there were not many), 2) If you are a young energetic couple who like walking anywhere from 10 to 30 minutes or more to see the major attractions including museums and Harbor cruises (the MoMA was only 2 short blocks away, conversely, the Circle Line cruises were many many blocks away, a half-hour walk at least) 3) Lastly, if you can get a great deal online from an outside company and not from the Shoreham website; do your research and book in advance! For example, try Easyclicktravel.com. We bought through their website a few months in advance and paid up front in full. In the end we spent a total of $609 for 4 nights, which comes to about $152/night and this was Wednesday through Sunday. It was a great deal considering how difficult it can be to get a quality hotel at this price during tourist season with a decent location (Central Park only 4 short blocks away, Rockefeller Center 5 blocks away, Times Square 10 blocks away). If I can get 4 nights at this price again, I would definitely stay at the Shoreham. ---Last note, if its your first time in NYC, get the Citypass. You can see 6 major sights for $79 including the Statue of Liberty, Circle Line cruise, Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Center and some museums like MoMA and the Met. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but architect should be fined”
Reviews.Author: PGC94102
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great bargain for a NYC midtown location. It's just between Fifth Avenue and Sixth Avenue on 55th Street, so it's walking distance to everything you could imagine in Midtown. However, because it's in the middle of the block, some of the rooms only have windows looking in to a dim lightwell. If you are out and about all day, this doesn't bother you too much because you just want to collapse in the bed, which is very comfortable. The only complaint that I have about our room which was quite spacious with its two queen sized beds is that the bathroom is about half the size of what it should be. The architect could have taken a few extra feet from the bedroom to expand the bathroom. As it is, only a very, very small person would find this airplane-like restroom adequate. We spent a total of $532 for two nights including all the sales and room taxes, so the price is something I definitely cannot complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Small but stylish”
Reviews.Author: ElaReviews
Reviews.Content: We were staying for two weeks in NY and we have tested several boutique hotels like Affinia 50, Shoreham and Elysee one. Shoreham is the option for people who like modern rooms, decorated in style, but the rooms are really tiny. Initially we were placed in a room with inside view, into the illuminator and it was dark all day long. You couldn't say if it is night or day, cold or raining outside, which I really hate. We were moved two days after in a room with the view on the street and it was much much better. The same tiny room, but better as a feeling. The staff at the reception was great and found as the room to switch, although it was fully booked during our stay. Also they have a free coffee machine all day long near the reception which was a bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous surprise!”
Reviews.Author: MalibuCindy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a long weekend at The Shoreham in Manhattan. The location was perfect for a tourist with a penchant for shopping! Designer boutiques along 5th Ave and Madison Ave are just a few steps away. Central Park is nearby, too. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. I don't know Manhattan well, and the front desk staff went above and beyond to give me addresses and directions to a number of spots. My room was well-appointed and comfortable. The bathroom was downright enormous by Manhattan standards, and included a large walk-in shower. The room included a massage chair which was heavenly after a long day on my feet. This is the only hotel where I never heard a sound from neighboring rooms. I loved the "business center" - 2 computers and a printer in an alcove near the lobby. Wouldn't work well for a business traveler without his/her laptop, but perfect for checking in for my flight home & printing my boarding pass. I was a bit nervous before arriving since I had read some unfavorable reviews online, but found them to be incredibly inaccurate. I had a wonderful stay at The Shoreham and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap-looking boutique style hotel off 5th Ave”
Reviews.Author: Monkey1970
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 night stay over Christmas in a Deluxe Executive King Room. Offer booked included 1 night free. Great value on the face of it. When we arrived on Christmas Eve, we found room to be large, but shower room tiny, and I mean tiny! Room was cold, dark, with stained carpet, chipped furniture and a view of a brick wall a few feet away. Complained to front desk who could only offer a lower grade room, as needed to have bigger bathroom. That's right, a cheaper room, Superior Plus King, gets you a full size bathroom with tub and shower over. The room was clean, bright and had a more homely feel, and the view....of dirty windows of the back of buildings opposite, but at least the room was lighter. During the stay we found the room was well cleaned, but the common areas scruffy. Breakfast and breakfast area were unattractive and uninviting. On the plus side, free internet, including in room WIFI. Complimentary coffee, from a self service machine off the lobby. And complimentary newspapers. And the best thing is the location. (And Aveda products in the bathroom!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very posh, comfortable and hospitable!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbehl
Reviews.Content: really good rooms, and fabulous service. I especially liked the fact that they had a complimentary 24 hour tea and coffee area. Great location too, just around the corner from 5th avenue!

Reviews.Title: “Small But Nice”
Reviews.Author: SpursMad
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay in New York. We decided on the Shoreham due to it's fantastic location and were not disappointed. Being on 55th it is handy for just about anywhere. 5th avenue is a matter of yards away, Central Park a five minute walk and Times Square twenty minutes at most. The hotel itself is bright and modern. Lime green and chrome is its signature. The rooms are small but have everything that you need. I'm not too sure about the frosted glass in the bathrooms though! If somebody uses the bathroom in the middle of the night the other person will be woken up by the light for sure! The beds are very comfortable and the linen of good quality. The bar and restaurant were being redecorated over our visit, so I cannot comment on them. There is, however, a coffee machine on the ground floor that is free to use and I can highly recommend the coffee itself. All of the staff were really friendly and helpful and could not do enough for us. There is storage for your cases after you check out, so if you are not leaving until the evening, as we were, you can leave your luggage and make the most of the day. All in all our stay was a pleasant one. I am rating it as a three overall as it was not cheap and the sizes of the rooms did not reflect in the cost! Also as the bar and restaurant were not available I cannot judge them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but starting to look tired”
Reviews.Author: KiwiInPimlico
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this hotel because I've stayed here before and thought it was great. Unfortunately the rooms are starting to look worn (chips on the bath, paintwork needs refreshing etc) and the weekend staff that we dealt during our stay with didn't 'deliver smiles' as the hotel website promises. The bar never seemed to be open when we wanted a drink and the room service breakfast was disappointing. I had also forgotten how small the bathrooms were, and I don't understand why there is only one hook for towels, robes etc when we had a double Queen room! On the plus side, it is in a fantastic location, and we got a very good deal for the 4 nights we stayed. While the room didn't have a view, it did mean it was quiet, so no traffic noise to keep us awake. The glass of champagne on arrival is a nice touch and appreciated. Not sure that I would bother to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night Midtown getaway”
Reviews.Author: drhad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to spend a weekend in New York overnight to include dinner and theatre. I choose the Shoreham based on mostly these types of reviews and travel websites(Expedia, Hotel.com, Kayak, etc.) It seemed its costs and review quality were of value. We were pleasantly surprised. The experience started with a very helpful doorman who took care of parking the car and assisting with luggage and its storage . We had arrived at 10AM and our room was to be ready close to check-in time-3PM. Daphne, a very attentive and cheerful front desk person, started our paperwork, offered us complimentary water, champagne, or use of the free lobby coffee, cappachino, expresso machine. She also asked for our cellular # so she could call us when our room was ready. We then left and shopped, walked around, got our TKTS for an evening musical. My phone rang aound 2PM and it was Daphne telling us our room was ready , a promise kept. Our room was a King Suite with a Sharper Image massage chair, two wall mounted flat screen televisions, Bose radio, two closets all for around $250 with taxes not including parking. Its location is one half block west of Fifth Ave., four blocks north of St. Patricks Cathedral- very central.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but no smoking please”
Reviews.Author: zorrajean
Reviews.Content: - In a nut shell: Tiny hotel with wonderful professional friendly staff. Centrally located. If you are not going to stay in the hotel very long or are just looking for a nice place to place your head at night the Shoreham will do just fine. Every thing about this hotel is Lilliputian including the business center (2 computers 1 printer) The lift will fit two adults with two suitcases. The Room is large by Japanese standards small by American. - Smell: At check in I was not asked a key question. "smoking or non" My tiny room had the smell of a giant ash tray. I was so tiered from my journey I did not want to bother with asking to change rooms. - Sound: My room was right off the lift and the stairwell. Rather noisy for the night before a fleet of meetings. With out a sleep aid I would never have fallen asleep. - Sight/Decor: The decor was pleasant albeit trendy. disappointing was the upholstered head board looked was stained. and although the carpet appeared clean the cigarette burn added to the doggy feeling or the room. - Touch/comfort: the bedding was soft and seemed to be a decent quality however the mattress had the divot the size of a large man. The Bathroom was very clean and the hotel soap was of good quality. however the terrible lack or counter space could have been over looked if the shower curtain did not have an odd stain on it. I am willing to give the Shoreham a 2nd chance based more so on the quality of staff then the lack of quality in up keep.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Jotenjo
Reviews.Content: they treat you well here and it isnt really too far from a lot of attractions in NYC! REALLY CLOSE TO SHOPPING

Reviews.Title: “best location of new york”
Reviews.Author: tkSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: I had been in this hotel in three times and I pretend stay there many others times. Has a nice location, good service and comfortable but a little cold rooms. Ask for the suites with a massage chair, so useful after a long day in new york. It's my home in this incredible city, Taiza

Reviews.Title: “Almost very good!”
Reviews.Author: mgarn33
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is superbly located which is why we chose it. Janice Woodburn who handled our reservation could not have been more helpful. She did us a great deal - bettre than Expedia, Last Minute etc.... However ....................... Don't turn up before 1500 check in time as you will not get a room. I was fourth in line to see the solo receptionist and none got a room - not even a check, just 'come back at 3' Having said that the 1200 check out is generous. The web site misleads for our grade of room. We had a superior plus king which was a fine room (if you accept that 'boutique hotel' rooms are generally smaller than traditional). However there was no complimentary water, which there should be in a 4*, and the web site leads one to believe there is. One other issue is the practice of only having one receptionist who is also concierge and lots of other functions. We would of course stay there again as these are 'operational issues'. The hotel is fine, the complimentary coffee a blessing and the bed extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here. Overpriced, underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: jim_dolan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past several times and it has gone downhill. Here is what I got for $415 a night. Feb. 1, 2010, checked into room 501. Room was very cold, as in too cold to take off your coat. Maintenance had to turn on the heating in the basement to warm the room. Heating pipes banged and clattered all night. I couldn't turn off heat or even adjust it down, and it became unbearably hot. That night had to crack the window open to keep the room livable. Cooking grease odors flowed in through the window. Big gap around room door not only let in light, but allowed me to see feet of passersby. Room's only phone was cordless and lost signal every few seconds, so was unusable. I carry cell phones from two carriers (Verizon and AT&T) and neither got signal, so I was effectly out of touch with the world. I tried to change rooms the first night but was told hotel was sold out. Morning of Feb. 2 a water hammer started in the shower, banging and rattling rhythmically, so loud that I couldn't stand it. Several of us in the fifth floor changed rooms. Feb. 2 moved to room 208. Same heating problem; couldn't turn down heat so had to crack open windows. More cooking grease odors, plus a new problem: tobacco smoke stink from employees smoking just beneath my windows. They wouldn't leave. Heating pipes banged incessantly. Light bulb burned out in ceiling reading light over bed. Desk lamp switch wouldn't work and lamp was on when I arrived. Had to find plug and yank out the cord to turn it off. TV remote didn't work and maintenance promised replacement but it never came. Room had no hair dryer, although one was brought after I stepped out of the shower and called. Between pipe banging, heat and stink, was up and down much of the night opening or closing window. There was, of course, no pen to use in filling in the comment card. You know, the price sets the expectation. For a lower price, this would have been a different experience. But for $415.45 a night, this was a loser of an experience. I will not be back, and I recommend same to anybody else.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in midtown NYC”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: Pros -- Very nice staff (helpful and friendly), good price for a December stay in NYC after the tree has been lit, good location (a few blocks from Central Park), room was actually a two-room "suite", extremely comfortable bed, two flat screen TVs in the room plus a Bose Wave radio. Cons -- smallish bathroom, decor in the room was kind of worn (chipped paint, etc.), the hotel furniture (couch in the room, seats in the restaurant) were very low and not so comfortable. Overall -- a nice "find" in NYC and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Dancake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights. Location is good. The lobby is probably 20 sqm. Staff are polite but not welcoming. The rooms: really really small. Bathroom: really really small. Bed: really really small and too soft so if there's 2 of you prepare to cudle all night long because you'll sink to the midle. No views. So, try another hotel. With the amount of money Shoreham costs you'll find other hotels, also well located (if not better) where you have a bed where you can actually sleep. It takes more than white walls and funny lamps to be a modern luxury hotel. Would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Left early and would never go back.”
Reviews.Author: newyorkerinflorence
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gross. The rooms are miniscule. I switched rooms and upgraded to a suite but then I still felt like I was sleeping in a night club/frat house. It feels used, dirty and cheap. I left immediately the next day and would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: leroyk
Reviews.Content: I usually do not step out of my safe zone when traveling. Let me explain, there are chains of hotels that give you a "safe" feeling in strange place. So I actually cancelled my safe hotel for the Shoreham. I was not disappointed. Very convenient to shopping, museums, food and the subway. The Shoreham is an interesting place. Something very different in mostly good ways. Great staff in the lobby. I passed on the complimentary drink at checkin. Elevators are small but the rooms are above average for NYC. Not bad. I have seen smaller. Massage chair was great. Shower temp and pressure were oh so nice. Bed was comfortable. The strange. Sink and toilet are so close together you have to reach under the sink to flush. One of those we installed it and did not think moments. I have been in hotels where the shower nozzle meets your belly button. So this was more of a wtf than a major issue. The convenient. Grocery store right around the corner to avoid mini bar surprises at checkout. Subway on a few blocks away. Beware. My hotel bill had someones food and drink from the bar on my first night. The front promptly took it off. Mistakes happen. I would definitely stay here again. I just wish they were part of a loyalty program.

Reviews.Title: “Feel you have been cheated”
Reviews.Author: ozman4
Reviews.Content: On our first time in NY on the suggestion of AA vocation agent we booked for 2 nights, hotel is centrally located other than that I did not find anything in this place which could justify the amount of money they charge. Lobby is contemporary one person in the front desk dingy elevator and then there is the room one can hardly turn around without hitting or bumping into something Bathroom is the pit small minuscule steel basin (one you see on TV in the prison) the carpet in the room you don't feel like stepping on, Yes bed and pillows were acceptable, Wifi is horrible I will stay away from this place in future

Reviews.Title: “Pretty cool, for a few minutes, then the past its prime sets in.”
Reviews.Author: SuitNflipflops
Reviews.Content: Pretty cool, for a few minutes, then the past its prime sets in. If the service was great, it might make up for it, but in 3 nights in the hotel, I was pretty much ignored. At least I didn't pay all that much for the room and the empty bar (again, although modern and swanky) served moderately priced drinks (for NYC). Best part of the room was the massaging chair, Aveda products and a very comfortable bed. Otherwise, the room was pretty small and the bathroom totally sterile. Moverover, the all metal sink and shelf reminded me a bit of prison. While flat screen TVs are now standard in most high end hotel rooms, mine was an older Dell model that took a while to turn on and had poor reception. Note: Free internet access and 24 hr espresso.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot to get away!”
Reviews.Author: Isze8473
Reviews.Content: The Shoreham was an excellent pick for me. When I arrived the front desk staff was friendly and offered me a choice of water or champagne (I chose the latter). I stayed in a queen deluxe room with a massage chair. The room was clean and comfortable. I got a reasonable price for this room and airfare as a last minute package. I'm extremely happy that I chose this out of the other options. I would stay here again even though it was difficult for me to find.

Reviews.Title: “Making good out of a bad situation”
Reviews.Author: tonkatoi
Reviews.Content: This if my first time making an effort to write a review about a hotel and I could not pick a better one to start with. I decided to surprise my boyfriend with an overnight get-away to New York and found a great deal on a overnight stay at the Shoreham. Unbeknowst to me my boyfrend HATES the city so much that I suggested several times that I would take the "L" on the cost of the hotel and we could head back to Maryland. Well after it was decided that we would proceed with the trip we get to the Hotel where upon check in they offer either bottled water or a glass of Champagne as the hotel representative is checking me in she inquires about what brings me to the city I tell her it was a surprise and the surprise was really on me because he HATES the city she smiles and makes suggestions which I doubt he would enjoy. To make a long story short we go out ot grab a bite to eat and upon our return the hotel rep sent a complimentary bottle of champagne and strawberries to our room. The only regret I have is that I did not get the hotel reps name to thank her again and make sure her name is mentioned in this review.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MarkKwok
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at the Shoreham. My flight arrived at 6am in the morning and couple days before my arrival, I emailed the hotel and asked if there was any chance of an early check-in. I received a response the same day - there was no promises but the hotel said they would do what they can to accomodate me. Upon arrival, I was greeted by the same person who responded to my email (I think she is the manager). Not only did she gave me a room right away, she upgraded me from a standard room to a suite. I stayed there for 3 days after which I went to Washington, DC. I returned to the Shoreham after that for another 3-night stay and i got upgraded again to a suite. I was very pleased with the hotel. The rooms (all 3 times of my stay) were clean and the expresso machine (at the lobby) really comes in handy. I will definitely stay at the hotel again. PS. There is a supermarket around the corner of 55th Street and Madison, just 1/2 block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Hip in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Seektravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shoreham for one night with a friend to just have a fun night out in NYC on a Saturday night. The Shoreham is a pretty hip type hotel, and they give some nice extras like they have a Complimentary 24-hour cappuccino & espresso for our guests. We were put in the Penthouse Suite which was a very decent size room with a small balcony. (not overlooking anything worth seeing) The hotel's feel is small, hip and boutique. The hotel is in a good location with the subway about 2 blocks a way. It is in a nice safe area. There is a bar and restaurant though I did not use it. There is also a gym on the premises and I noticed some computers in the lobby that can be used. The hotel is clean, safe, well kept and I would definately recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with good location!”
Reviews.Author: FifiOctopus
Reviews.Content: I like the single room since it is comfortable and trendy. Good food and wine in the bar restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sal04
Reviews.Content: Mid-town location was good and within easy walking distance of Central Park, 5th Avenue and various other sites plus a number of Subway stations for going further afield. We stayed in a superior king room which I thought was a pretty good size and we were not bothered by any noise at night. The free tea and coffee facility was quite useful however we didn't use the bar or the restaurant so can't comment on them. We didn't find the hotel staff particularly friendly or helpful but they were fairly efficient and this was not such a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations, Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: nofun711
Reviews.Content: A friend and I ended up booking a room through Hotwire and got the Shoreham for a great price. Room was small, compared to the chain hotels I've stayed in, in my past 3 trips to NYC but the room, the location and the service were well worth more than we paid! They wouldn't/couldn't upgrade us because of the price we paid through Hotwire, but the room, with 1 Queen size bed, had more than enough space for the 2 of us to be able to maneuver around each other and all our luggage. Our room faced the back of another building, but you don't go to New York to get a room with a view and honestly, this was the quietest room I've ever stayed in, in NYC. We did not hear any obnoxious honking or emergency sirens at all, which is a rarity in New York. Our first night, there was no hot water in the shower, but upon reporting it to the front desk the next day, they had it remedied while we were out for the afternoon. Simple clean rooms, stylish lobby and lounge area and great amenities... would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: PeteCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Nov 2007, for 3 nights. I got a suite with sitting area and bedroom. The accommodations were excellent, but the bathroom was ridiculously small. Desk service was non-existent. This place believes it caters to celebrities, so if you want prompt attention, you may need to wear shades and act like a prima donna. Otherwise, location was great. For better value for the money, stay uptown in the Upper West Side.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spiros78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shoreham Hotel for 7 nights and we can say with no doubt this hotel turned out to be a very good choice for accomodation in New York at a very good price (in comparison to other hotels of the neighborhood which were much more expensive). The hotel was very centrally located on 55th str (which is surprisingly a rather quiet street) next to MoMA, 5th avenue, Central Park and close to Rockefeller Center. There were also 2 nearby subway stations. There were also many nearby cheap places for quick and good food (self-serviced delicatessen bars etc) The decoration of hotel's lobby and the decoration of our room was minimal and stylish with simplicity and no exaggeration.The room was quiet and large, extremely clean, with 2 double extra-comfortable beds, nice and simple bathroom, a plasma TV and a radio/CD player. We were given a complimentary glass of champagne upon check-in, we also had everyday unlimited complimentary capuccino and espresso all day long, plus complimentary press everyday at our door (the New York Times & the weekly TimeOut New York magazine). There was also free wifi / internet (2 pc available for the guests + printer). There was also a gym but we never used it. The staff was polite and smiling. Upon check-out (12 noon) we had our luggage kept for a few hours at no extra cost. When we came back to the hotel to pick up our luggage, the hotel staff immediately helped us finding a taxi to JFK airport . Overall a very good hotel experience! Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “as long as you don't spend much time in room, place is great”
Reviews.Author: ekter
Reviews.Content: my 12 yr old son and i spent a couple nights there on a weekend. our room thursday was literally as small as a room can be, and still have a queen size bed. we were pretty sure the bathroom was bigger than the bedroom. and the "window" looked out into a ventilation shaft. but we checked out fri morn (other commitments fri nite) and came back to the shoreham saturday. i guess they weren't busy, because we got a free upgrade to a huge suite. the staff was very helpful and friendly. we got our room thru an online deal ($159) so i didn't expect the best room, but the suite was a nice surprise. the location is ideal--you're right in the middle of the theatre/times square area

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: teoand
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to the Penthouse room, with a very nice balcony, no street noise at all, a fantastic massage-armchair, and two big flat screen.. it was a fantastic experience. The hotel is located at few steps away from the MoMa, few block from The Rockfeller Center, and in a very strategic position to visit NY. Aveda shampoo, nice staff, design elements in the little lobby were the cherry on the cake. I really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: waynecom7
Reviews.Content: This a lovely hotel - contemporary and very chic. The staff were very welcoming and the service was great. Good buffet breakfast served in the bar. The location was also great. The room I had was lovely but....it was the smallest room I have even seen in a hotel - even by new york standards. I could barely get between the end of the bed and the wardrobe (which was more like a cupboard). Really nice hotel - but I was climbing the walls after a few minutes in the room. Everything else was great - if you're there for shopping/siteseeing etc and not likely to be spending time in your room, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking, there is better for equal or less”
Reviews.Author: Richtravels_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night to attend a conference at the St. Regis. The room was on the second floor overlooking the air shaft and the HVAC duct work. Tiny room, but the bed which took up the whole room wasn't bad. Modern design, grey/muted color scheme with glass walled bath room. There are better hotels in NYC for the price and depending on what you are in NY to do there are better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: YippeeeToo
Reviews.Content: We booked on line with expedia and got a great discount for booking our flight at the same time. We booked it based on location and the reviews at the time. Mostly because we wanted to have an Boutique expereince with out paying boutique prices. It was better than we expected and we've the decor. I'm pretty sure that they upgraded our room to a bigger room. I would definately recommend The Shoreham to friends. I think the next time we go back we want to stay in a different area of the city but otherwise we would go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Davo73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shoreham in Aug/Sept for one week. It is the perfect location for everything you want to do in the city, especially shopping! I was there with a friend and the room had plenty of space - was a bit worried with the small room reviews I had read. Only downside - the staff, don't expect them to help you find restaurants or give you any tips at all really. Will be going back

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Many Flaws”
Reviews.Author: Renmaris
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a business colleague. He has probably never stayed there. The first room I got was so small I went back to reception and handed them the key saying that unless I got a bigger room, I would move. Ended up in Room 201 which is larger but still very modest for $500 per night. Air conditioning was of the 1950s variety; stainless steel sink was so small as to be virtually useless and there was no hot water. TV had about 15 channels and ESPN was not working for the entire 3 days. The restaurant is noisy and has lousy food. The wireless internet never worked (I went round the corner to Starbucks for internet connection). On the positive, the staff were nice and seemed to realize they were in a joke of a hotel. Plus it is a great location. But for that money, avoid the place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the Shoreham!”
Reviews.Author: Expedia_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I was going to NYC with a few friends to celebrate a birthday. We decided to stay at the Shoreham. It was an excellent experience. We shared two rooms with queen beds. You have to know that this hotel is constituted of two separate building next to each other, joined by the lobby/reception area. Each of us had a room in each section. The room are very similar but here is what is different: One is much larger, but the design is somewhat regular compare to the other. Bathroom in this one was extremely small. On the othe hand, the other room had an exquisite design but the size was rather small. Bathroom was very big and beautiful. Both room were very nice, thinking that this is NYC, where rooms are usually very small with little to no bathroom... These two rooms were very very nice for NYC and for the price paid, this was very good. There are no ice machine on the floor that can wake you up. Just call room service and ice will be there in a few minutes. Forgot to ask for extra glasses, those will be ther in minutes as well. They offer both a bruch/buffet breakfast and a menu breakfast. My friends and I each took the brunch and the "a la carte" breakfast. For the price in NYC, these breakfast were enormous and very good (and I'm picky on food). One thing not to miss is their coffee/espresso machine near the lobby: free coffe, and really good one too (also tea and warm water) I loved the Shoreham and will book there again next time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “what a horrible hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: guyfromwyoming
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Shoreham hotel for business. Normally I stay at The Dream hotel, but they were sold out. I should have listened to the hotels they suggested!! I got to the Shoreham at 430p to check in and the Front Desk Agent couldnt find my reservation. I advised them I had a confirmation number, but was told that the hotel was sold out and that my name wasnt in the system. I asked to speak with the manager and was advised that he was in a meeting. Finally after arguing with the agent, he finally agreed to look up the confirmation number. The agent who took my reservation mispelled my last name!! Then the rude agent told me that the room wasnt ready and would have housekeeping work on it ASAP. I took the redeye to NY, worked all day and all I wanted to do is sleep. I had to sit in the lobby for 45 minutes until the room was ready. I wasnt offered a free drink or any apologizes. Upon entering the room, it was so small. I wasnt able to sleep with all the noise from outside!! It sounded like the window was open yet there was no windows. I called to the front desk to see if I could change my room & was told no the hotel was sold out. The food in the bar area and room service was horrible. I had to wait 30 minutes for breakfast. My eggs were cold and the room service waiter was so rude!! Complaining that I only tipped him $3!! I called my travel agent and thankfully she was able to move me out of the hotel, the next day!! I would never suggest anyone staying at this hotel. Its a dump, the staff is rude and not worth $25 per night!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: uh-oh-hot-dog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Shoreham for 3 nights. We were quite pleased with the hotel. The hotel is very modern looking. The carpet in the hallway looks very clean. The room itself looked clean and there was ample space to move around as when reading some reviews I got a bit scared that it would be too small. The shower was good. I did not have any problems with the water temperature as I read in another review. The hotel was pretty quiet which we liked. We never saw anyone on our floor and were mostly by ourselves in the elevator. The cappacino station on the 1st floor was our favourite part. You can get hot chocolate, latte, coffee, tea, etc. It helped in the morning to wake us up when we were rushing to get our day going. We just grabbed something to drink for our morning walk to whereever and it tied us down until we got something to eat. The first night I found the noise from the street quite loud and seemed as if the window was opened although there were no windows, but the rest of the nights I slept find, probably because we were so dead tired. We didn't get bathrobes in our room - Superior Queen. I thought our room didn't get it but I just read now that we should have gotten them. And the housekeeper was inconsistent with the towels she brought. First time, there was no bath mat, then next she didn't replace one face cloth then next night we got 0 face clothes. But it wasn't a big deal or else I would have asked for more. I would recommend this hotel definitely. This is our first time at a boutique hotel and loved it. IT would be nice to try others. But that cappicino station was AWESOME> and a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, modern boutique hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: screamingmimis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Deluxe Luxury Queen room on the 4th floor, and it was a dream - spacious, modern and clean. When we walked into the room, we were greeted with 3 pieces of fresh chocolates on a designed plate (not just pre-wrapped chocolate) along with a handwritten note from the hotel manager, which was a nice touch. Also, since we were celebrating my friend's birthday, I called ahead to request that a small card with a particular inscription be left in the room upon our arrival, and this was nicely done. I requested the same of 60 Thompson in Soho, but their reply was that they were a boutique hotel and couldn't do it. The bathroom was luxurious, with 3 shower heads, although for the 3 days we stayed, we always had variable-temperature water. It would go from hot to cold to lukewarm back to hot - all very quickly so as not to scald or freeze, but the water temperature never stayed constant. At first I thought this was from other guests flushing toilets, but that doesn't explain the range of temperatures nor the frequency of change. Also, with all 3 shower heads on simultaneously, the drain rate was not fast enough and water began to accumulate and rise in the shower. Shortly after arriving we went to The Bar for an afternoon cappucino pick-me-up, and when we returned to the room, we had turn down service and 2 brownies on our bedside! Housekeeping was always quick to respond to our needs (ice and extra sheets). The free internet on the lobby floor came in handy when we wanted to confirm subway directions to the Brooklyn Museum - 2 computer stations with 1 printer, although the printer was out of service. The elevators were small, but there were 2 and each fit 3 people with 3 suitcases comfortably, and they were never overcrowded, which was nice for a boutique. Also helpful were the displays on each floor letting you know where the elevator was (sometimes the little things make a big difference). The midtown location is very convenient. When we went out for dinner Friday night though, it took 5 minutes for the bellman to hail us a cab - not many came down the way. Overall, a clean, modern boutique hotel with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Always lovely and dependable”
Reviews.Author: LaBu
Reviews.Content: The Shoreham is a smaller property hotel in a great midtown location. We always stay here when in NYC because it's convenient and accessible. The rooms have the minimal and soft white color design. The rooms have a calm and serene feeling. It's really quite a challenge to make all this work in midtown but The Shoreham succeeeds. The front desk staff is very helpful (no attitude) and the housekeepers are quick and efficient with your room.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in a great NYC location!”
Reviews.Author: SaraFeld
Reviews.Content: My stay here was great. We found the room spacious and clean and the staff were so helpful and friendly. There is free internet, gym use and a cappuccino machine 24/7. Also, the beds and pillows were the best I've ever slept on in a hotel. The hotel itself is trendy and modern and in a fabulous location that is close to Central Park and Times Square. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ALIEN-EYE
Reviews.Content: The first room they gave me had one or two cockroaches waiting, and it was dirty, so I was changed to another one that was smaller and without a bath. The room themselves are all very small and uncomfortable. The main light of the entrance of the room was not working and was never replaced during my stay. The view was to to a brick wall two meters away. In the room itself the only table was filled with a nice Bose sound system and a huge TV set. That is: no place to work in your own room, no place to write or anything else but sleep and watch TV. The hotel itself is pure design, but very unpractical. The worst was whay they called "Business center". They have wifi in the rooms, but I called before to find out where there was a place to check the internet so I could leave my laptop at home. "Of course", they said, very proudly. Actually all they had were two computers in the hallway that separated the elevators from the gym, with a lot of people wanting to use them and ugly pop music blasting from the loudspeakers. Besides, the connection always broke and the printer's cartridge had no ink and was never replaced during my 10 day stay. You must have a lot of nerve to call two computers a "Business center". All this in a very eexpensive hotel, with much better alternatives available at the same price. Suming it up: design, unconfortability, bad service and cockroaches. Don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: disneydreamsnh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shoreham for three nights in April 2008. The location of the hotel was excellent, on W 55th between 5th and 6th ave. However, the room was very small, like most in NYC. Our room seemed even smaller, due to the small window with a view of the fire escape/alley. Little if any light even at mid-day. The room was very clean, and was cleaned promptly by staff upon our departure each day. The complementary coffee/tea/and hot cocoa machine was nice in the Am and after a long day. We weren't offered champagne upon check in, like advertised, and like the couple checking in before us.....this was disappointing. The positives did out weigh the negatives as we did get a good deal on this room via hotwire, but we would likely stay at a larger near by hotel during our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: WalkerofHalifax
Reviews.Content: I was in Shoreham with my daughter recently. The hotel is in excellent location and tastefully decorated. Front dest people were very warm and helpful especially Debora and Laura (I don't know whether I spelled their name right). Highly recommended. Love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Guaranteed Return Guest - Loved My Stay at the Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: Doglover4life
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I've ever written about a hotel. Traveling to New York was an experience but what made it even better was staying at the Shoreham. It's a nice, modern and friendly place to stay in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. Everything is within walking distance (Time Square, Central Park, Rockerfeller Center, MoMa, Broadway Shows, Restaurants, Shopping, etc.). I loved the fact that it was located off a quiet street which allowed us to sleep the whole night. There was even a liquor store conveniently located around the corner from the hotel. The staff was very helpful and frinedly. The rooms were unlike any other place I've stayed in...there was a massage chair, huge walk-in shower, comfortable bed and most importantly clean/modern. My husband and I will be going back in May/June and plan on staying here for both of our trips. I can't say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Shoreham!”
Reviews.Author: travelfromsfla
Reviews.Content: What a great, chic hotel. I loved the spa suite. The room and bed were very comfortable, the furnishings and color scheme were quite cool, and the location directly in midtown between 5th and 6th Avenues was perfect. You couldn't ask for more centrally located!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mzplacedinphilly
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I had to book a hotel for a last minute meeting that was scheduled and decided that I was tired of the usual suspects - major hotel chains - and booked the Shoreham - figured what did I have to lose with a one night stay. I was surprised at the comments concerning lack of personal touch and service. I was suprised to check my vm at work to find that they had left me a message the day of my arrivial welcoming me and looking forward to my stay. Check in was a breeze and was offered a glass of champagne or water upon arrival. Room was of typical size for New York - on the small size - but thoughtfully laid out and spotless. Loved the ijoy chair! Bed was extremely comfortable. Aveda amenities in the bathroom which was quite roomy. The self serve espresso machine and free wifi rock. Decor is very modern so would not for those who like flowers and dust ruffles. Great location and wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: MommyBean
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel tucked away from on W. 55th street...very close to Madison Ave, Central Park, Broadway Shows and Rockafeller Center! Its a great Mid-town location so you can get to anywhere uptown or downtown. You are only a short cab ride or subway ride from everything. I liked how the building didn't scream "HOTEL" the setting is more like a chic mid-rise NYC condo! I loved it! The hotel was quiet very clean...my room was sleek contemporary and very comfortable...loved the 45 inch plasma tv! and the 24hr expresso bar Loved it! The room was small but hey thats NY baby. It was a lot of style but in a very cozy end inviting setting. Perfect for a couples weekend in the city or a girls/ boy get-a-way or shopping trip. When I return to NYC which will probally be this summer I will definitely return to the Shoreham!

Reviews.Title: “Too much design!”
Reviews.Author: SimonFlyer
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd try the Shoreham as a change from my usual hotel in NYC. It's in a good location on a relatively quiet street and the decor is impressive if an acquired taste. The designers took an old hotel and gave it a great makeover but they were quite constrained by what they had to work with. The lobby is very strange, very unobtrusive from the street, nice idea but it was a mess and the very low ceiling is just weird. My room was small and there is very little soundproofing so I could hear the conversations from next door. There's a flat screen TV and a massage chair but the room was generally quite uncomfortable and very very dark as the only window looked out onto a "light" well but needed the blind closed for privacy. The bathroom is stainless(!) steel which looks trendy but a bit industrial. Opposite the toilet was a huge frosted glass window with no blind. I felt very uneasy as I am sure with the light on people in nearby rooms would see enough detail through the glass to be embarrassing! The bathroom was very cold indeed. There was almost no storage space so my case had to stay open on the floor throughout my stay, making the room feel even smaller. Overall, the hotel is very trendy and OK for a short stay but you wouldn't want to spend too much time in the room. The most annoying thing was the lift - the lift call button is on a pillar in the middle of the lobby away from the lifts themselves causing a certain degree of confusion and disorientation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: bluidechik
Reviews.Content: This hotel is magnificent. Beautiful decor, very friendly staff. Reserved a single Queen, but when I arrived with my son asked for a double bed and they upgraded us at no charge to a Penthouse room. We had a wonderful first time experience in NY sightseeing as well as me working at my office in NY. Very informative on where to go and what to do. Always courteous and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable. WiFi reception excellent. New movies at no additional charge. Within walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “No personal touch”
Reviews.Author: m77-marty
Reviews.Content: We booked through expedia a room with a view, I called a week before flying to ny to make sure everything was ok. Upon arriving to the hotel we saw about 15 people waiting at the lobby, so we simply went to the modernish restaurant they have facing the street and had a late lunch. The doorman took care of our bags and after about an hour of having lunch we approached the front desk to check in. The first issue that came up was our credit card not being read by their system, then our room was not ready even though it was 4pm and check in time is advertised as 3pm. Then, once the very cold concierge gave us our room keys, our bellman helped us to our room, which upon arriving to it was not clean. We went back to the lobby with the bellman to sort this out and we found ourselves caught in the very uncomfortable position of listening to a manager talking down to one of the front desk people. The bellman tried to get this manager's attention but enough time had already gone by and enough had been said that made me and my girlfriend realize that there is no personal touch in this hotel whatsoever. Once the manager realized we were waiting, he turned on this strange smile and directed us to another person at the front desk. The lady who finally helped us get into a clean room was very quick and efficient, though we realized that the level of stress at this lobby was making us very uncomfortable. We have been very lucky to travel around the world and we have always left tips for employees, specially for maids, but after running into these uncomfortable situations, we decided to write a review online so that hopefully true honest sincere service does become a reality. Not only so that other people do not have to run into uncomfortable situations, but also because service starts with respect, something that this manager evidently does not have towards his employees. To make a long story short, messy and delayed check in, strange behavior at the lobby, good restaurant, good drinks, good location. Still, we would not recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: lvsurf
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed for 7 nights over Thanksgiving week at the deluxe 2 queens room. The room was very big, but the bathroom was small. The room faced another building so we couldn't open the shades, but that wasn't a big deal. The room was hot even though it was very cold outside, so we had to turn the AC on from time to time (I'm glad the AC worked, or we would have been miserably hot). The location is excellent, just half a block from 5th Ave. The staff was friendly and the two computers in the lobby were very convenient to use. We felt that paying $16 for a continental breakfast at the hotel was way expensive for what you got, so we just went to Cafe Europa a block and a half away. There are other choices of places to eat nearby as well. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, but Clean & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shinbun
Reviews.Content: The two of us stayed at The Shoreham Hotel Nov 16-23, 2007. The Superior Queen rooms are small but clean, most of the room space taken up by a very comfortable queen sized bed. The bed leaves very little space for moving about the room. To give you an idea: 9 paces from the door to the window, turn left, and 5 paces to the wall. There is one chair parked beneath a narrow table surface (about 18 inches wide?), between the bed and the table surface. If pulled out for sitting, the path from the door to the window is blocked. We ended up repositioning it between the bed and the bathroom, and parking a suitcase on it, as there wasn't really much room anywhere else in the room for suitcases. There is a small closet on the right as you enter the room. It contains an iron, an ironing board, and a safe for storing valuables. The bathroom is small with a stainless steel sink which drained slowly so we called the engineer to fix the stopped up pipes - he came up immediately and fixed the problem forthwith, so we thought, until it started plugging up again, so we just let it go as it was not a major issue. The heating and cooling worked perfectly, no problems there. There are 2 handheld phones in the room, one by the bed, the other on the narrow table ledge.

Reviews.Title: “Worst "Luxury" Hotel Ever! Got no sleep!”
Reviews.Author: esquireflyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly awful. The bathroom floor is marble and is FREEZING at night. There is no heater in the bathroom. Moreover, because my bathroom door did not close (the hinge was broken!), the cold air floated out into the bedroom. The bathroom is right next to the bed, and the cold kept me awake for hours. I turned the heat in the bedroom up to maximum, but was still not able to warm up the bed (which is next to the bathroom and far from the heater on the other side of the bedroom). I called guest svcs for slippers to walk on the bathroom floor; they forgot to respond. After a few hours, I finally fell asleep, only to wake up about 3 hours later because the room had somehow heated up to a roasting temperature, and I was sweating. I turned the temp back down a bit, but it was very slow to respond. Further problems with the room: 1. the front door (to the hallway) will not close without being slammed. 2. bathroom door won't close at all. 3. There is no bathtub, nor a shower stall or even a curtain. Just a shower head in the middle of the wall, which floods the whole bathroom (and bedroom b/c the door doesn't close) when used. 4. The sink is tiny, and is slanted downwards ,so water spills onto the floor. I got only three hours' sleep despite eight hours of trying. If you get Room 210, you should IMMEDIATELY change rooms or check out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “little piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: KKY
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in the best location and still with an affordable room rate (it's all relative). It is steps away from The Pennisula Hotel, and 5th Ave.. Great selection of restaurants on the same block. We have a Superior King w/ bath tub and a great shower, flat screen TV, plenty of closet space for short stay. The bed is heavenly...and the bedding is lovely...my young daughter enjoyed it so much she used it as launching pad! Staff are very helpful and friendly. Elevator is very efficient. There is a fancy Swiss coffee maker provides free coffee/tea/hot chocolate on the lobby floor around the clock. I was able to fill my daughter's milk bottle as needed - how convenient is that!!! there are also a couple of computers in the lobby for the guests free of charge. They also deliver New York Times daily free of charge...Yes, i do have to pay for the room, but it is defintely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: leeds29
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a three night stay in this hotel,with two teenage children. The location was FANTASTIC, when we arrived they upgraded our room, from a small queen bedded room, to a suite ,the bath room was small, however it had all the neccesities. The children's room was upgraded because they had been given a single queen to sleep in, they got upgraded to a larger room with two queen beds in. The hotel bar looked lively however we were all too busy to get a real taste of the atmosphere. The staff at reception were very helpful . The children enjoyed the free use of the internet, and overall it was a convenient and pleasant stay we would return if we were to go back to New York. The hotel is not a huge sky scraper,however it was a good size, there were no real views out of the bed room windows, especially the childrens which looked into a well, the rooms were always quiet, the beds comfortable, good bed linen and air conditioning was great.Also free coffee from a machine 24/7. we thought it was good value especially with the upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Stylish & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alanwexford
Reviews.Content: Had looked at a number of other hotels and got a great deal for the Shoreham through Travelzoo. It was our first time to New York and the hotel is ideally located just off Fifth Avenue. Rooms are very modern with flat screen tvs. The continental breakfast was great and so were the staff. Very friendly check in\out! Will return again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Weekend at The Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: mgmatz
Reviews.Content: After reading such mixed reviews I was a bit apprehensive about this hotel. However our experience turned out to be very positive. Our check in was efficient on a busy Friday before Labor Day. We (my husband and I) booked a superior king at a very good rate (breakfast included) and were happy to find that the room was pleasant and a reasonable size for NYC. Our room had a massage chair (a wonderful way to relax after walking and sightseeing) and the bathroom had a tub with a good shower head. We were on the better side of the hotel and this and the great room rate had a lot to do with our satisfaction with the room itself. There were extra perks that also added to our favorable opinions..a daily New York Times, the free coffee bar, and really terrific staff that always had a smile and were helpful and so pleasant. It was always a pleasure to go to breakfast or have a drink at the bar and chat with the staff . I am guessing that there must be a wide discrepancy with the queen and king rooms and that makes it more difficult to know what you are getting and adds to the mixed reviews seen here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Love this hotel....and the great staff!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brighton31
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience. My friend and I just came back from spending 3 nights here. The staff went above and beyond...especially Sorin. The room we'd booked was not ready when we arrived, so we were upgraded (at no additional charge) to a penthouse suite with a balcony and incredible view. The hotel is IMMACULATE!!!! Not a speck, not a spot, not a grain of dust anywhere. The food was wonderful...delicious and artfully presented. Every member of the staff was so helpful...the lounges were comfy...fresh orchids were everywhere (even in our bathroom)....shower was huge and had 5 shower heads...cushy slippers...lattes, coffee, and tea were free...we would go back in a heartbeat!!!! Truly a hidden gem in NYC!!!!

Reviews.Title: “So many better places to stay in NY for the money”
Reviews.Author: jenandluke
Reviews.Content: 10th anniversary - DH and I never had done anything this romantic (have 2 kids now) in a looooooong time. We are very easy-going, not snobs at all. Live in Westchester and decided that rather than spend the weekend flying somewhere exotic, we would enjoy NY as tourists do, nice hotel, good restaurants, broadway play.
