Shoreham offers the Spa package, but before booking I call and ask specifically if we can book the package but in a king superior room, but still get the spa package deal, with champagne, chocolates, some body scrubs or whatnot and spa treatment. 1st thing, they book us in the junior suite. nOT a king bed. Very uncomfortable for us, we are not obese, but not petite, and, the point is, I specifically requested the king. When I called the front desk I was robotically politely informed that there were no other rooms available and that I didn't want them anyway. No view. Shower ran water ALL over the floor (they should add a lip on the door to prevent this - should cost them all of 25 bucks.) Shower was awesome though (many heads in this suite) although I would have given them all up and the jacuzzi (I told them this when I called to book it in the first place) for the KING SIZED BED.) Free breakfast is continental, not the hot menu. Bar is nice, and bar staff was nice in the evening, snooty in the morning. Didn't get the chocolates or the bath spa stuff. the spa treatments were across the street at a nice little place, and very nice. SPoke to concierge? Hideki 4-5 times, first time when we were checking out, who promised me they would make all the above right by me, including the missing package items. He promised some female manager whose name escapes me would call. No call. I called many times. no call from the mystery woman. Also, WAS OVERCHARGED for the shoreham's valet parking at the lot next door. they charged me 145, and i was told 45/day. We were there for 1 1/2 days. Figure 75 tops, right? Recieved a tiny box of Lindt truffles and 45$ back for the parking, and never heard from them again. If they respond to this review, just know that they are just a mill, hoping most people won't complain, but AvOID THE SPECIAL PACKAGE. IT'S JUST A ROOM IN NEW YORK CITY. Next year we are spending only a little more and going to spend the weekend at the Ritz Carlton Battery Park which is LOVELY and similarly priced. Oh well, 11th anniversaries are just as special, right????

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oliversacks
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, just walking distance from the theatres. The staff was friendly and there was free water, champaigne, coffee, and hot chocolate. The hotel was very clean with a modern decor feel to it. This hotel can be for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Service, Bait and Switch room placement”
Reviews.Author: silverfig
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to enjoy my experience at the Shoreham. Highlights: Great location near 5th Ave Shopping, Excellent Bar and Delish Room Service. Good selection of inroom movies and Nice Flat Screen TV. Drawbacks Had to seperate reservations and when I called ahead to sync them up I was told I was being comped the better room and turned out I was given the less valuable room. Also sheets are uncomfortable and internet wireless DID NOT WORK. Everytime I called for help I was told no one could help. This is disappointing when the Hotel touts itself as internet/Tech savvy !

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: bb9350
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We stayed there 4 nights and room was always back to new when we arrived back everyday. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room had a great layout and the bed is very comfortable. Our bathroom was small but how much time do you really spend in there. If you do want a bigger bathroom than I would suggest you ask for it since they have many different room layouts. Also, the free coffee/hot chocolate/expresso machine was GREAT. Loved the free WiFi as well. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good centrally located hotel but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: doublebzz
Reviews.Content: Spent 4th of July weekend at the Shoreham after winning bid on Priceline.com. Priceline categorized this hotel as 4 stars but small room with one queen size bed and shower without bath tub would, in my mind, disqualify it from 4 stars and put it closer to a good 3 star hotel. The view from 4th floor window was facade of adjoining building. Having said this, the Shoreham was the first hotel I ever stayed where I was offered champaign during check-in process. Location is great particularly if you want to avoid the havoc of Times Square area. The bedding was extremely comfortable, air conditioning worked great and the room was very quiet. Courtesy coffee/capacino/cocao bar and bottled water along with great TV were nice touches. In summary, the Shoreham surpasses the many other similarly priced hotels I've stayed in during frequent NYC visits.

Reviews.Title: “"Okay" is as far as I can go.”
Reviews.Author: steph77andre
Reviews.Content: OK is as far as I can go, although my brother thinks otherwise. The best experience at the hotel was the check in, after midnight. So fast it was amazing, perfect after a long flight. Well, that was it, because we get to the room and it has only one small bed, obviously not what we had booked. We decided to simply show up at the lobby in the morning, so I go to take a shower and my brother is already trying to sleep. I happen to pay attention to the water which is draining towards the bathroom floor but I think nothing of it. Unfortunately, the water got all the way from the shower, onto the bathroom floor and then to the room’s carpet. I had to use a few extra towels to dry out the carpet and the bathroom floor, of course by now my brother was helping me, I had already made too much noise and that room was, to put it in a nutshell, a "tiny walnut". The next morning when we are heading for the elevator, we run into someone who seemed to work at the hotel . He was a handyman and he already knew about this specific issue in this specific room. Now there was no question about it, we needed a room change. Not only two beds, but please a bathroom that does not drain onto the bedroom. Luckily Daphe, the reason for this review, took care of us immediately. She asked us just two questions and said she was setting things up, so we tell her that we would like to talk to a manager, to which she nodded as making a call and continuing to work. She said that the manager would be with us shortly and that our new room would be ready in less than 10 minutes, so we decided to wait at the lobby, which by the way has very low seats. After about five minutes Daphe calls us to the desk. As we are standing up she gets interrupted by another phone call. At this point, out of the clear blue sky, a person who introduced himself as Ireki, while handing us a card, let us know that the general manager was not available. I was about to let him know that we were not in a rush, specially given the fact that our new room may now be ready, but he did not seem to know this. He started telling us how sorry he was about the incident and how this never happens, contrary to what the handyman had told us a few minutes before. I decided not to make him feel uncomfortable and I simply ask to leave a message for the general manager, which I did. I then try to go back to Daphe but I got once again awkwardly approached by Ireki who was asking for a confirmation of my booking, which I had already shown to her. At this time Daphe, who was still on the phone, hands me a new set of keys and waves to the bellman. Ireki was now in silence. Our bellman, Zaty, helped us go from the tiny walnut to a two beds real size room, he was ever so kind. After our few nights at the shoreham I must admit that I was impressed by the level of cleanliness and the professionalism of Daphe and Zaty, but we did not get a call back from neither Ireki, apparently the head concierge, nor the general manager. Daphe saved our trip, we asked for her upon leaving, but she was not around. We did not feel comfortable leaving a tip for her during our check out, they seemed to be very busy and somewhat disorganized during that sunday morning. All in all cool bar and bartenders, the entire lobby is all white and marble, extremely minimalist. The flower arrangements were very sophisticated and chic, although they did not match the cheap looking, low seats at the lobby. Also, the coffee machine that is literally two steps away from three public restrooms, definitively not a good choice for location. The Hallways on the floors were not air conditioned, neither were the elevators, extremely hot. Room type booked was not at all what we were given. Very clean rooms, excellent location, good rooms with two beds, tiny rooms with one bed, some showers leak onto the bedroom, no discounts nor amenities given nor offered, no answer from management, so thank God for Daphe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, hip hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SteveUrq
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our weekend at The Shoreham and we were quite pleased with the hotel and our room. Not sure what the person who wrote his review on June 22 is complaining about, but the hotel is just fine. The room was a bit on the small side and I've never been in a "queen" bed that was that small. But the furnishings were nice, the cappuccino machine in the lobby was a nice touch, and all in all this was a nice place to stay. The front desk staff were mostly helpful although they had this quirky way of seeing someone approaching the front desk and then quickly occupying themselves with something else or making a phone call ... not the best customer service but not the worst either. Flat panel TV in the room and Bose stereo were also nice touches. Some things we didn't like: the bathroom door didn't close, the hinge was broken; windows to the outside world seemed like they'd never been washed on the outside; the phone in the room was not working correctly and we didn't get our requested wake-up call on the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, hip spot.”
Reviews.Author: scoremedia
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot....just down the block from the Peninsula and around the corner from Trump Tower. Was in town for the Cotto-Judah fight at MSG and to get a clean room from 299 just off 5th Avenue is a deal. Was even lucky enough to get street parking just outside the hotel for my rental because I got back from MSG late. Rooms are small but shower looked brand new and nice LG flat screen. Can't see why anyone would flame this joint.....

Reviews.Title: “Was a great central hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline1983
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend visited NYC in April and I had spent hours researching hotels to stay in after hearing that expensive and tiny rooms were common in the city. I chose The Shoreham, as for a central boutique hotel it seemed like a good value deal, and I got a great deal with a small London-based independent travel agency, much better prices than the website or expedia. My tip is to search around for web prices, they are drastically different! Once we'd arived at the hotel, we were given our room by helpful and friendly staff (I'd read they were very unhelpful). We had the lowest priced double, but it was not as small as I'd imagined and had a large double, very comfy bed, huge flat screen TV and en-suite with huge and very powerful shower. Very simple but stylish and had everything we needed for a city break and base. Also, we really liked the bar, which was small but perfectly formed with gorgeous cocktails. We didn't try the food but the bar menu seemed nice too. When we left we had an evening flight and were worried about leaving our luggage but the staff obviously get this a lot and have a designated room that you can leave your luggage in for no extra cost. Just don't drink anything from mini bar - extortionate for a water! I'd conclude that this hotel is a good all-rounder, excellent location and well worth it if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendously improved!”
Reviews.Author: homesick_and_grumpy
Reviews.Content: A year or two ago, I submitted a review of the Shoreham that was not very complimentary. The place had grown shabby, noisy and threadbare. Now, I'm happy to report the Shoreham has made a terrific recovery. I believe all of its rooms have been thoroughly overhauled and updated. Its capacity has more than doubled with the addition of a new west wing. And, although still pricey by national standards, the Shoreham - for its location and amenities - is an upscale bargain in midtown Manhattan. I've stayed in a lot of different rooms since the remodeling, and they are all more or less stylistically similar: neutral beige walls offset by mildly tufted, patterened, sea-green fabric wall panels. Furnishings and wall decorations are blonde wood with simple, modern lines. The beds are high and very comfortable, with a generous array of pillows. Lighting is minimal, but all dimmer-controlled, and the room can go from bright and cheery to shadowy and romantic. Here too are thoughtful touches such as individual reading pin spots over the bed, and headboard lighting controlled from bedside. Each room is equipped with a nice LG flatscreen TV, with a remote that actually lets you adjust the screen dimensions so that regular broadcasts aren't elongated and weird-looking; the Shoreham is the only hotel I've ever found that gives you that option. My only problems with the TV are 1) a limited selection of channels, and 2) no in-house movies or games. There's also a Bose clock radio/CD player with a remote, a couple of phones, and a generous number of well-placed wall outlets. Wireless internet is free, fast, and easy to use. There are two free computers and a printer near the lobby on the ground floor, which seem to be busy all the time. Each room has a little refrigerator stocked with costly little sweets and drinks. I've not checked out the fitness center, but from the literature it appears to be well-equipped and available around the clock. There's a decent food and snack menu available 24 hours, and a convenient (if pricey) valet car service at the front door. Although not quite a "scene," the Shoreham Bar is colorful and comfortable in a futuristic way, sort of like The Jetsons' rec room. The location - around the corner from the heart of Fifth Avenue shopping and touristing - is a huge asset. You are within easy walking distance of great restaurants, the subway, buses, Madison Ave. businesses, and Central Park. You can walk across the street to rub shoulders with celebs and the rich at the Peninsula's bar, or head a block south to attend that conference at the Hilton. If you must, Times Square is ten short blocks away (although why you would remains a mystery to me). While not exactly bustling with activity at night, this Sixth Avenue neighborhood - once a ghost town after dark - is slowly coming into its own, with a number of comfy bars, late-serving restaurants, a Starbucks and a few expensive convenience stores. On warm summer evenings, the post-theater tourists and local happy-hour lollygaggers mingle to create a diverse street scene. My only quibbles: many rooms are spacious by New York standards (and especially by comparison to the dinky broom-closet rooms at the Hudson or the Paramount), but the bathrooms are so small they look like they were designed for the Space Shuttle. Forget about two of you in there, just one of you at a time, and even then you'll be bumping into the walls. The multiple-nozzle shower is cool, but its cubicle so tiny that it's hard to keep the showerhead from spilling over onto the bathroom floor. This is a major flaw in the redesign, especially when the bedroom has enough floor space to hold a square dance. Also, after throwing all that money at the hotel's re-do, would someone at the Shoreham please please PLEASE wake up and equip each room with a full-sized ironing board? The little desktop doohickey they provide is a royal p.i.t.a. to use! All around, the Shoreham is an attractive, comfortable and convenient stay at a reasonable price (price depending on the season, as with all NYC hotels). Look for online bargains, or call and haggle, there seems to be quite a bit of wiggle room in their rates.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Ingersoll
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on Travelocity. Advertised as a four star hotel tho I'm not sure it quite rates that way. I would put it at a 3.5. Rooms are small as indicated by other reviewers, however, they are clean, modern and well laid out. Bathroom was tiny but never felt that way. We had a two bedroom suite. Two parents, two kids. Perfect for a family tho parents should note that the bedrooms have no doors. TV's are modern HDTV flat screen wall mounts. No pay per view but full cable. Staff was helpful. There is no concierge per se but the front desk staff were very knowledgeable and helped with reservations, etc. Room service was lightning quick. Food was pretty good for the one meal we ate in the room. No ice machine but no charge for room service delivery. What would bring me back to this hotel is the location. Two blocks south of Central Park South. What more can you say?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in convienient location”
Reviews.Author: TravelinZoe
Reviews.Content: While we initially had some trouble with the check-in process and some quips with the front staff, the hotel was overall very nice. We booked our trip through TravelZoo at $199/night rate for the weekend and also stayed our 1st night through their MOMA package. While we were supposed to get early 12PM check-in with the MOMA package, we were told at 2:45 when we arrived, that our room was not ready. As far as the early check-in, I was told, "We have no record of that. Your room is not available." After coming back after 3PM, it appeared the initial front staff person had no clue what she was doing while the other people in the front staff did. Our room was the standard queen room. It was very clean and an okay size for NYC standards. The bathroom had a pretty large shower which they could have probably made smaller and made the rest of the bathroom bigger. The bed was very comfortable. The room was extremely quiet although part of that had to do with the fact that we were on the 9th floor not facing the street. The room had a mounted plasma. The only complaint was that the A/C was very cold and the vents pointed at the bed. Since the room is smallish, it would tend to get stuffy if the air wasn't on, but when the air was on, it was freezing cold. Keeping the fan on (without the A/C) helped with the problem but then made the room somewhat noisy. We got free continental breakfast one morning with our MOMA package which was very nice. However, we discovered on check-out that we got charged for the breakfast. The front-desk was polite and took off the charges. The hotel is located just off of 5th ave next to all of the fancy shops. It is 1/2 block from a subway station (F line) or about 2 1/2 blocks from 2 other subway stations with more line choices. It's also close to a small supermarket and drug store. For $199/night, this was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Javierignacio
Reviews.Content: As usual I searched for the Shoreham Hotel in Tripadvisor.com. When I got there I was gladly pleaced. The location could not be better. Just 3 blocks from Central park. Just a few feet from the Hotel Peninsula. The room was the size that one can expect from a hotel room in a mayor city. The interior design of the rooms and public areas was very nice and modern, and the staff friendly. There are two or more metro stations nearby as well. Overall, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: dan339g
Reviews.Content: Overall I was very pleased with my stay at the Shoreham. I booked a "Superior Queen" room that I got for $199/night via a special advertised from Travelzoo.com. As others have noted, the room was a bit cramped, but that is not unusual for hotels of this class and price range. It was very efficiently configured, and the condition of the room was excellent with a flat screen TV, high quality linens, tasteful decor and a spacious bathroom. The room was also very quiet given it's interior location. There was one small window that looked out to an interior air shaft and the adjacent rooms resulting in an unappealing view. Fortunately, the HVAC worked very well, so I just left the curtains drawn. I did not use any of the hotel ammenties other than the free wireless internet in the rooms (easy to connect), and the free latte machine in the lobby, but the bar looked quite pleasant and seemed active in the evenings. There is also a very small business center and fitness room, but they both appeared to be in good condition. Given the convenient location and quality of the accomodations, I would recommend this hotel as a good value.

Reviews.Title: “small room,great location”
Reviews.Author: gioiellini
Reviews.Content: I was surprised @ smallness of room,tho' it was fine for my 18 yr.old & myself(we're not big)as we didn't intend to spend much time in room. The location was perfect:close to all 5th Ave. has to offer;proximity to MOMA,Central Park,and subways ,theater-all within walking distance. The bathroom was large;wonderful shower! but the best surprise? it was so quiet! we were able to sleep soundly(no street noise,no hallway noise). The staff was friendly,and helpful(I was able to store luggage;they got a taxi for me when it was raining;told me subway i needed to take). It seems like a great place for 20-30 -somethings for romantic getaway(the bar/lounge very modern).

Reviews.Title: “I would repeat it!!!”
Reviews.Author: jc12100
Reviews.Content: After checking that hotels in NY were very expensive and most of them are deteriorated by the use, we were very careful to choose the perfect one. After staying 5 night in The Shoreham, we are very happy for the chosen one. At the first sight, you can't imagine how good it is because the entrance is not very spectacular. Nevertheless as you are entering the hotel, the atmosphere is very modern, not as many hotels in NY. The room was as modern as the entrance. The furniture was very smart and there was a huge plasma screen TV hung up in the wall. The staff was very friendly, not as it is supposed in NY. And the rooms, as they're not huge, are fine. If that's not enough, there are 2 things that I haven't seen in many hotels. Near the hall, there are 2 computers in which you can surf in Internet free!!! That's awesome if you are far away from home. And the second one is that there's a free coffee machine you can have free coffees and hot chocolates. And they are quite good. I would recommend this hotel to every people who wants to stay in NY. For me it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: dinaleah
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations! We did have a king room which is bigger than the queen rooms. The beds were wonderful and plenty of room for a NYC hotel. The location was perfect and many excellent restaurants within a couple of blocks. The 52 inch flatscreen TV was great for catching the March Madness games. Our deal on [--] included the ($16.00) excellent buffet continental breakfast. We really received an excellent deal! The staff was friendly and very helpful. There were some mistakes on our bill and they were taken care of immediately. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cooked alive!”
Reviews.Author: pachin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, and the rooms are small, but very well thought out. However, there is an "A" side to this hotel and a "B" side. The "B's" get cramped hallways, rooms impossibly close to the clanking elevator and temperature controls that don't work, unless you want high heat. I had 2 rooms in 2 days in "B" and each time the temperature was the same; boiling and not adjustable. The A side is quieter and cooler. I stumbled upon this side by accident.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Mid Town”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: This is a great mid town hotel. The rooms are very comfortable, the beds are to die for, the price is right and you're in the middle of everything. Ask for a king room, it's only a few more dollars and it's much bigger than the standard. The lobby bar is very cool, too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort,value and a few extras”
Reviews.Author: breccia
Reviews.Content: Our daughter goes to school in New York so whenever we go to visit we check out different hotels, hoping to find that perfect spot. This time we stayed at the Shoreham, whose location on 55th between 5th and 6th is close enough to be able to run in Central Park, and is just down the street from the posher St. Regis and Peninsula. Overall it was a good experience. Front desk staff were efficient and welcoming and our rooms (we treated our daughter to a break from dorm life) were clean and comfortable. Our executive King even came with a terrace - too bad the weather was freezing! Our winter special rate included a buffet breakfast with lots of delicious fresh fruit, granola and pastries. The Aveda bath products were very pleasant - there was face and body cleanser as well as the usual shampoo, conditioner and moisturizer. Free internet access and a large flat screen TV were much appreciated. I would definitely recommend the Shoreham for budget minded travellers who enjoy a touch of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at Shoreham - unhelpful concierge”
Reviews.Author: Diana482
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average, there are definitely better hotels in NYC for the same price. Very small room with worn carpet. Flat screen TV was nice. Rooms need to be freshened up. Concierge said he would be glad to provide any assistance needed, then when we called and asked him to make us a dinner reservation he said he would and then never called back. Make sure you get free breakfast included in your rate. Good location. Located at 33 W 55th St, NY, NY 10019

Reviews.Title: “Shoreham staff great!”
Reviews.Author: lightinggod
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Shoreham Hotel, and I must say, all those rumours about New Yorkers being rude are entirley and completely false! I hd a wonderful time! The front desk staff was incredibly wecolming and friendly and made me feel at home from the moment i walked in the door. Scott and Ellie are a comedic duo worthy of Broadway! Their cheerful demeanors kept me entertained whenever I passed through the lobby. The hotel was clean, stylish and full of fun amenities like the endless supply of lattes. It's location is cenral to many attractions including Time's Square and Rockefeller Center. Overall, I ad a lovely experience, though be advised, the rooms are tiny and there isn't enough counter space in the bathrooms. (clearly designed by a man without hair products!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NYCvisitorRichmond
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Shoreham between Christmas and New Year's, and we were pleased at such a nice hotel for a decent price. The rooms were small but were really clean and decorated in "hip" fabrics and decor. I really liked the Bose radio and the modern touches. One especially nice feature was the hot beverage bar downstairs with complimentary drinks. We never left without a drink in our hands. The location is great; it's situated between 5th and 6th, only a few minutes walk from Central Park or Rockefeller Center. We never ate in the restaurant since there was a cute French restaurant across the street and Klein's grocery just around the corner on 6th Avenue. There are bigger, fancier hotels if you want to pay the extra money, but I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMParis
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Shoreham just before New Year's Eve. We were 2 couples and they booked a Superior King room and a Deluxe Executive King for us because we were afraid of the size of the rooms after reading several comments. The one of our friends was nice, not too small with a big bathroom. But we were very disappointed with ours when we checked-in. We were expected a large room and it was just a little bit bigger, but the shower room (no bath) was so tiny we couldn't move, neither put our toilet bags. Actually they used a part of the bathroom to get a bigger room. What's more it was on the street, so very noisy because it is very badly soundproofed. The difference of price (about 200$ more per night) wasn't justify. So we asked for the same category of room as our friends. They agreed and gave us a Superior King room with a huge bathroom. Good points: the bed and the sheets are excellent. Nice decoration with smooth colors. The room is very clean except a stain on the carpet . Wifi access in the room, good breakfast, coffee and tea bar available all the time. We asked for a plug adaptor we got immediately. Negative points : the heater is very noisy. The customers are not very young, for a boutique hotel. We use to go in 5 stars hotels all around the world (Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, Amanresorts...) and we have a lot of expectations. This hotel is an excellent value in New york for the 280$ we paid per night (they had an amazing promotional rate for this period) with a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MICMAC07
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this amazing hotel in Nov 2006. Booked a one bedroom delux apartment and it was amazing. We were weclomed with a glass of Champagne or water. The room exceeded our expectations and the bed had to have been the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept in. The best bit was the "ijoy" massage chair....just what one needed after a days shopping in Fifth Avenue!!! Highly recommended hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy room and great location.”
Reviews.Author: UKplane
Reviews.Content: Both my Girlfriend and I wanted to see the New Year in NYC but having never been to NY, were not sure where to go. We ended up booking Shoreham hotel due to the price and the location of the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 11.30pm on the 28/12 and although the woman doing the check in was not the most friendly, the service was quick and efficient which you want at that time of night and after a long flight. The hotel itself is small, yet I was impressed with the services it offers such as gym, free coffee and a very nice bar. We had booked a superior queen room, which I thought was great although maybe a tiny bit small. The bathroom didn’t have a bath, but instead had a huge shower, which had enough room for two people easily. The bed was fantastic and really comfy, great after a long day in the city and the flat screen TV was a nice addition. The location of the hotel is awesome, between 5th and 6th avenue and not that far from central park or Times Square. A Subway station is only around the corner, which makes the city easily reachable. Just a word of caution, the subway compared to the underground in London is a bit confusing, however get a free map and it does help. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to visit the city on a short break and visiting NYC sites is a must for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Shoreham - like a crab in a shell”
Reviews.Author: dadontheroad
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel at 4:30pm, our room was not ready and we were assured of an upgrade. The upgraded room was slightly larger than the cells at Alcatraz. The window was in the corner of the room and was tiny, which in particular made the room feel claustrophobic. The bathroom had no shelves or hooks (you had to close the toilet top to have a place to put your shaving kit). The closet was about the size of a phone booth (if you're old enough to remember what the size of those are). The staff had a bit of an attitude (like they were doing you a favor). There were some pros: the bed was comfortable and there was free wireless internet access. Walking distance to Saks, Bergdorf, St. Patricks.

Reviews.Title: “Fake”
Reviews.Author: stardif
Reviews.Content: Just back from New York and decided to write a review about the Shoreham. (Stayed Dec 13-14). I did not know that the term “boutique” was synonymous with garbage. This hotel is a joke! The best part of the hotel is their web site which they effectively lure people in with their trendy look and feel but do not be fooled! Behind the façade is an overpriced scam! We were very disappointed in the size of the room, particularly for the price they charge, but more infuriating was the response from the front desk when I went down to see them. They make you feel like a piece of (-) just for asking about getting another room. By the way I was not the only one, every time I walked past the front desk someone was complaining about the rooms. The rooms are manageable for one night but we were staying 5 nights and it is simply not practicable. Yes I was disappointed in the room size and the price, but the number one complaint was the front desk service. None of them seemed to be able to deal with the situation and the only alternative I was given was to upgrade for 200$ a night. How did I deal with the situation? I went on Trip Advisor, found a hotel called Dreams jut 2 blocks away on 55th closer to 7th ave and 200$ a night cheaper, walked 2 blocks west, up to the front desk and got a reservation for the last 3 nights. Walked back to the Shoreham and asked for my bill and told them I was checking out. True to form, the front desk girl, whom I had never seen before, looked down at the computer, printed the bill, did not ask why I was leaving 3 days early, did not asked how was my stay and did not even thank me. Packed my luggage and walked over to the Dream, a true boutique hotel where they actually seem to care that you are a customer. Avoid this pretentious joke of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about the Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: chigagotraveler
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Shoreham for a weekend. They were fully booked with the Christmas Holiday Rush and the Shoe Show PRO: Very nice staff. Check in very pleasant. Had to wait until 3 o'clock, but they stored luggage. Bar area very nice and was always busy.. Bed very comfortable-Shower good pressure Convenient location to FIfth Avenue. NEGATIVES Room size- extremely small-and we were told we had the largest room in the Superior category. Bathroom stark and no hooks anywhere to hang towels. It was smaller than any cruise ship room in the lowest category!! It seemed as if they sliced two rooms in half. Carpet quite dirty too. Smoke was pouring through the vents from people smoking in non-smoking part of hotel. Really made our last night not pleasant at all. Not sure if we would go back, cannot beat location but room size was really too small. Might be okay for single business traveler. We did not want to go back to the room to relax at all since it was so cramped. We had a fun weekend, but have loved other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: travelpalooza
Reviews.Content: Would I pay the regular price to stay here? No. But considering the $199 a night I paid, which included daily breakfast, I would definitely stay at the Shoreham again. The front desk was fast, efficient, and friendly. The room was clean, modern, and very comfy. I stayed in a queen deluxe room - perfect for two people. The bathroom wasn't all that big but the shower made up for it. I loved the shower head. What makes this place special are the little touches - the Aveda products, the complimentary trendy magazines, the 24 hour espresso machine, 300 count sheets, flat screen tv. An even bigger plus to this hotel is the location. It's near so much. The only time I didn't walk and used the subway was when I ventured to Soho and Chinatown. Other than that, everything I needed was within walking distance. I can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool and trendy hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Oakapple
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night but would definitely stay there again. We booked a deluxe one bed suite on Priceline (excellent rate) and, having heard about NY hotel rooms, were surprised at how spacious it was. The bathroom is tiny with no separate shower. The bed is outstandingly comfortable. We enjoyed the free internet access downstairs and loved the overall design and feel of the place. Contemporary, yet friendly and welcoming. The bar area is great for a pre dinner drink, not too crowded on a Wed night but with a nice buzz. Our room was on the street (6th floor) but the noise was not a problem for us. One tip re airport transfer: leave ample time! Our taxi took over 2 hrs to get to JFK from the Shoreham and we missed our flight to London. We were advised (not by the hotel) that it would take 45mins so we left an hour and a half to be on the safe side. A combination of rush hour and a protest demonstration in Manhattan counted against us, so be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugMaryland
Reviews.Content: Great location, and the complimentary breakfast (if included in your package deal) can't be beat: fresh fruit, bagels, scones, granola and yogurt. The 24-hour espresso/tea station was great, too. My only complaint: the bathroom was cramped and not super convenient. The toilet paper holder was next to the toilet flush handle (awkward to find when seated), there weren't enough towel and robe hooks for two people, there was no fan and the bathroom door was about one foot away from the bed (no privacy!). The bed was comfortable and the t.v./radio, etc. was a nice touch. Plus it smelled like bacon when you opened the window (I love bacon!). No view (room overlooked an alley), but that didn't matter to me at all. We received complimentary glasses of champagne upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “What u see is what u get”
Reviews.Author: hendos
Reviews.Content: My husband & I from Australia stayed for 3 nights first then went on a cruise then came back for 1 night. On our 3 nights stayed in Penthouse (HUGE) on 11th floor room was very nice clean, with 2 plasma TV, Queen bed & shower was wonderful (Full Massage feature) in shower, but view terrible so didnt open blinds. On our second stay on 6th floor facing street, room was just as beautiful (HUGE) this time King bed, massage chair (fantastic) in lounge 2 plasma TV just as room shows in homepage of suite in Shoreham website, but with no massage shower this room but had a bath (bathrooms small) but it was very, very noisy & could not sleep. Staff very helpful, food good has room service & breakfast in bar room, gym available & free coffee & tea in lobby. Hotel has minimilist features & very contemporary design. I was very happy with stay & value for money (but don't stay in front rooms!!) & Lift is small but for us that was ok. Very central to everything in NYC. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Boutique Hotel,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Designgal
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here recently. The room Queen Superior was very nice. The window faced the street on the 2nd floor and was very noisy during the night, so we requested a room change for the next 2 nights. No problem, we were moved to the 9th floor.The staff was always polite, the continental breakfast was included in our room rate (a special) otherwise I would recommend something less expensive as their are many diners around the hotel. The bar was very busy on Thursday, but quiet on the weekends. Nice restuarant 2 doors down. It was called La Vineria (it was a small Italian place, very good and not too pricey) as this is in a pretty expensive part of the city. Location was great for both the West and East sides and Central park. Our son, who lives in NYC, wanted to stay over one night as we got in late and he was coming back early the next morning. I called the front desk and got a rollaway bed. No extra charge (for the additional guest or the bed) which I thought was nice.I would stay here again if I wanted to be in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoTraveler11
Reviews.Content: I visit New York quite a bit to see my daughter in the City and this hotel made this trip a real pleasure. My friend was meeting me and they made it particulaly easy for us to hook up. The front desk help were happy to help with anything you wanted while actually caring what it was that you wanted. I actually wanted to say Good bye to one of the clerks....now that does not happen too often in NYC. The room was small but not uncomfotably small and the flat screen TV and wine cooler and small refrigerator was quite a treat. Everything in the hotel was brand new, down to the faucets in the bathrooms which was kind of fun. The bathroom shower was actually huge...no bathtub though which was fine with us. The lobby was fun, the bar up front was open to the street and although we did not have drinks there at night, we did enjoy the continetal breakfast which had been included in our rate. The expresso machines in the lobby only put the icing on the cake since we could run down upon waking up and grab a cap to enjoy in the room with our New York Times which was delivered to our door even on SUNDAY!!! No pictures to share but all was very nice. I will always look for acceptable rates here when coming back to New York. Location easy to get to everything and there were restaurants on the block that were great when you were too tired to venture out any further at night. The Italian restaurant recommended by the front desk a couple doors to the East was one of the best up town restaurants I have been to and very reasonably priced, not cheap but not ridiculous. Not for families though, more a couples place with a good wine list. Anyone staying here will truly enjoy this hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, contemporary & modern, but staff could do with some training”
Reviews.Author: Hopwoodc
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 5 night stay at the Shoreham - here are my thoughts: Location: Superb! On 55th Street between 5th and 6th so right in the centre of Manhattan and close to Central Park, Times Qquare, shopping etc etc, handy for everything. Hotel General: Trendy, modern, contemporary and boutique. The ground floor area is lovely, great bar and the free tea, coffee, hot chocolate machine in the foyer is a nice touch. The fitness room is great and there's free internet access. The bar makes this hotel (be warned though you won't get a drink past midnight). However when you get past the trendy ground floor you can see why this is a 3* - it's just a little rough round the edges, although nothing to complain about. Check In: My partner arrived before me at 3pm in the afternoon (after an 8 hour flight) and the room wasn't ready. When I arrived in at 11pm - check in was quick, and the free glass of champagne on arrival is a nice touch. However, I wasn't offered any help getting my bags taken to my room so struggled with a suitcase, laptop bag, handbag and glass in my hand as the reception staff stood by and watched. Staff: O.K but a little -- and could do with being more helpful! I say this for the following reasons: 1. Check in as detailed above. 2. The door to our room was left open by the cleaner one day (you could clearly see it was open) and when I told reception I didn't get much of a response or apology! 3. We were woken up at 3am in the morning by the fire alarm and had to climb down 4 flights of stairs on the external fire escape of the building in the early hours of the morning (in the dark and rain) - no staff were on hand to explain why and when the fire crew said we could go back to bed the staff member who had turned up could give no explanation. The same night 30 minutes later we were woken again 3.30am - forced to go down the external stairs (again in the dark and rain) and again no explanation. When I mentioned to the staff the next morning that some communication would be nice I was given just a blank stare and the guy shrugged his shoulders and looked at me blankly - he clearly didn't care! 4. At 12pm one evening I asked for a drink at the bar and was told they were closed up - I explained I was a resident and was told too bad. This place could do with some customer service training. Rooms: We had an 'exec' room - good size, clean and tidy and functional. The room did smell a little damp I thought and I think this is to do with the fact that the bathroom has no fan so the damp from the bathroom circulates round the room. But all in all great (although the cleaner did forget to leave the complementary Aveda toiletries one day)! Overall - if you get this one on deal and can avoid the staff then it's a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Unique Modern Place”
Reviews.Author: babyface123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and very artsy! We stayed in a 2 bedroom room. It was a wonderful stay - beds were very comfortable. The shower was wonderful with 5 shower heads! Would definitely stay here again. The location was magnificent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: dummie
Reviews.Content: SPECTACULAR! That's a one word description of the Shoreham Hotel at 33 West 55th Street in the heart of New York City. Where should I begin? The spacious, immaculately clean rooms range from "absolutely beautiful" for a spacious, immaculately clean standard room to "awesome" for one of their magnificent Penthouse suites. How about the welcoming glass of wine handed to you at check-in where you are cordially ushered into the lush lounge while your luggage is swiftly delivered to your room. Or the slate and marble floors and suede wallpaper...Or the twenty-four hour complementary coffee, capuchino, expresso, tea, or hot chocolate...Or the exquisite newly decorated restaurant and cocktail lounge where residents meet in the evening...I could go on and on detailing all the magnificent aspects of this outstanding boutique gem of a hotel. I've saved the best for last...the UNBELIEVABLE friendly staff...each and every one of them as beautiful on the "inside" as they are on the outside. They will become "family" before you leave! The location can't be beat with access to everything needed for a memorable New York visit...theaters; restaurants; Rockefeller Plaza; Lincoln Center; Central Park; window shopping on Fifth Avenue; the Museum of Modern Art...You name it, you can walk to it! As a Convention Assistant, I am well aware what separates the "mundane" from the "wow" features in a hotel and, after two visits to the Shoreham, I would find it unthinkable to even consider a stay at any other New York hotel! The "cherry on the cake" are those in charge. Unlike every other hotel I've experienced, whether in America or Europe, Joseph Reyes, the General Manager, and Aaron Bozzi, the Assistant Manager, are visible and ready to assist you in every way imaginable! Trust me on this one...if you are headed for New York City, Make the Shoreham Hotel your destination...whether it's a business trip or a family vacation. This "jewel" will become, as it has for me, your "home away from home"! Jackie Singer, San Diego (Last stay-July '06)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Beage
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon, and I'm convinced this place is the best deal in NY. It was clean and comfortable, and has an incredible location for shopping and shows. This hotel shares the street with the St. Regis and The Penninsula hotels, so it's clear they're doing something right! It's a short walk to central park, times square and 5th Ave shopping. I think this is a prime area for a first time visit to NY. The only problem with this district is that there aren't many good restaurants in the area. The hotel itself is very stylish and trendy, and has incredible prices for what you get. Yes the room is small, but so is every room in NY. All in all a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: RWCBeverlyHills_CA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I sought a luxury hotel with a slightly lower price tag than the highest in the NY. The Shoreham's location is great for shopping and walking to theater. The staff is young, hip and tries hard, although a few looked too much like bouncers. Our suite had a decent sitting room with an uncomfortable sofa and a bizarre exercise chair that resembeld a Lazy-Boy. It did work. The bedroom was not good. There was only one end table by the bed. The cloest was tiny, but spacious compared to the bathroom. It couldn't have been more than 30 square feet. No room for toiletries or your feet. Impossibly claustraphobic. I guess you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Should Not Have to Sleep on Raw Mattress”
Reviews.Author: twcanter
Reviews.Content: This is a nice enough hotel in terms of lobby and decor. However, the bottom sheet and the mattress pad are under-sized and do not cover the entire bed. It is bad enough to have to sleep on the mattress pad but to also have to sleep on RAW, EXPOSED MATTRESS is simply disgusting. I hope they got a good deal on off-sized sheets because they did not get additional revenue from me as I checked out after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: jenlats
Reviews.Content: The Shoreham is in an excellent location and convenient to great shopping, Central Park, Radio City and the subway. Impeccably clean, quiet and great service. The staff is very friendly and helpful, even offering you a glass of champagne or water upon arrival. We found the room to be larger than expected for a boutique hotel, and the bed was extremely comfortable. If you are looking for a modern, clean and quiet hotel that is understated trendy and hip, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ultra Clean Bathroom Quiet 3rd Floor Room Classy, Low Ego Staff Great Location, yet quiet Street 1/2 Block from Trump Tower Sparkling Water upon Arrival

Reviews.Title: “You can do better in Manhattan than the Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: jackarch
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for my parents this past weekend at the Shoreham and they were sorely disappointed. As former natives of New York and world travelers, they certainly know hotels. Their issues were numerous: 1. Although advertised as a queen, the bed appeared to be far smaller than a traditional queen. 2. The tub was so slippery (and no mat was supplied) that my father was afraid to take a shower. 3. The air-conditioning was sub-par. 4. After viewing the dinner menu online, they booked a reservation --only to find that the hotel, in fact, does not have a restaurant. They did not want to eat dinner in uncomfortable bar seating, and so went down the street to La Cote Basque and had a very enjoyable meal. For a stay of less than 24 hours, I find these issues to be unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrudyLookingGlass
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a visit to NYC which included a stay at The Shoreham. We found the staff were not only professional but the most genuinely NICE personnel we've encountered. Our theater tickets were for the night we checked out so we asked about leaving our luggage. The general manager told us he still considered us to be guests of the hotel and invited us to leave our bags and return to use the hotel facilities before the show. Our large, tenth floor room was tastefully decorated in soothing shades of gray and white. Fresh lillies added warmth. The room was very quiet with lush bedding and a plasma tv but the best part was the shower with FIVE shower heads. No elevator wait was longer than one minute. A lovely breakfast buffet was included in the room rate. We will definitely return to The Shoreham and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jktravelbug
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to NYC for my birthday weekend at the end of March and booked this hotel. The best thing aboiut this hotel is the location. You are blocks away from all the stores on 5th Avenue. The hotel is a modern boutique hotel. I have stayed in hotels all over NYC. This is an average hotel in terms of ambience. We booked this hotel via a special on travelzoo. It was less then $200 per night which was a steal for the location and the fact that it was NYC. Rooms are sized adequately for NYC. Bed was very comfy. Bathroom was a little cold in decor (felt like a prison cell) but the water temp and pressure was fine. Great hotel if you are just looking for a place to sleep in between seeing the sites of NYC. There are better hotels though...... One big problem- parking was a rip off! We pulled in front to drop off our bags and the hotel bellman immediatly took the car to the Shoreham's off site lot. We were never given info about the cost of parking. (It pays to ask!!) The next day, they brought our car back and had charged us for 2 days because we arrived an hour before scheduled. Total was $90 for approx. 25 hours. You can park for much less if you park on you own!!

Reviews.Title: “Many small problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week in NYC. Unfortunately, the Shoreham isn't what all the "positive" reviews described. Well it turned out to be a bit of a saga. We arrived and spent the first night literally rolling towards the middle of our queen bed. Needless to say, we didn't get much sleep. The bed was way too soft and actually showed quite a bit of wear. We were surprised because this is the first time we've experienced this in NYC. We try to go at least twice a year. We've stayed at the old Empire, Pierre, Barclay, Drake, to name a few, and never had any problem. The next day we asked to change room and were told on the phone that all the rooms were booked and the best they could do was to change or flip the mattress. Well, after they changed the mattress, we couldn't detect any difference. We then went directly to the front desk and asked to see what could be done. All of a sudden, 3 rooms came available! The first 2 rooms had the same problem----the beds sloped to the middle. I guess for one person it would have been okay but not for 2. Finally, we were offered a handicapped room with a king bed. Hooray, it was a firm bed that didn't show the same kind of wear. The rest of the room was okay. There were other small things that became bothersome especially if you want NOT to have to think about your hotel while vacationing. The bathroom door didn't close properly. The sink, faucets and toilet were so loose we were afraid they might come apart if we were not careful. On Sunday morning, we couldn't get the water warm enough for our shower. The bottom sheet for 2 days were too small and kept bunching up during the night. We knew there wasn't going to be a coffee maker in the room (which was fine since most hotel room coffee is so borderline anyway) and instead a coffee machine was available on the 1st floor. The problem was that the machine was broken for 3 days. We asked for a wake up call twice and we finally gave up. The first day was fine. The second morning the phone rang 45 mins. earlier then the appointed time. The third day, which we didn't request for a wake up call, we received a call at 6:30 AM! We liked the location and the staff was friendly but very young. That may be the problem---experience! If a better manager can oversee the hotel, especially details, the Shoreham would definately improve. Erin at the front desk saved our stay! Thanks! As it is, unless you get a very good rate, $160 US or less, it's not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Friendly People”
Reviews.Author: chillyp
Reviews.Content: Great value, I found it on Hotwire for $149/n It shows up as a boutique hotel in midtown. The location is excellent with the Penninsula Hotel and the St. Regis just across the street. You can walk to 5th avenue in about 1 minute and Times Square in about 15 minutes. The bed was very comfortable and seemed brand new with linens I would have expected in a five star hotel. The place has just undergone a full renovation and it shows, however the actual quality of the work is poor so I would expect within a few years the place will begin to look shabby again. The staff are very friendly (especially Emily) and the free internet access, lattes and (american) champagne are nice touches. I would recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it just fine”
Reviews.Author: missmc123
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel on priceline for $110 a night. What a bargain! The location is great for tourists, right in midtown, close to the park and 5th avenue. The staff was friendly, the room was fine and on par for a Manhattan Mid range hotel. I liked the coffee machine ALOT. The shower was very weak and it seemed to be out of hot water on sunday. I would definately stay again if I was able to get that price. Maybe not if it was rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SFGRL3731
Reviews.Content: The Shoreham is a good-looking hotel. The lobby and restaurant/bar area reminded me of a smaller, more intimate version of the Paramount. It has the same "modern/trendy" feel. The rooms are 100% better than the Paramount, though. While still very small, almost to the point of being uncomfortably so, the rooms are well appointed with great beds and great large bathrooms. I loved the design, but only wish the rooms could be a bit bigger, especially around the bed and desk area. Since I mostly come to New York on business, I always need a desk area and this one was definitely lacking. The service was middle of the road, but on par with everything else I've experienced with other New York hotels. We had breakfast the next morning and it was just OK. The set up of the restaurant with lounge/bar seating does not make it conducive for meals. Since most folks visiting New York do nothing more than just sleep in the hotel room (meaning, they don't expect hotels to be resorts), this is a fine choice. This was an overall fine hotel experience if you want to stay someplace new and modern in New York for a good price and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “We love it”
Reviews.Author: acquagirls
Reviews.Content: We loved the Shoreham. It was a great location. The staff is very warm. When you check in you get a glass of champange and or bottled water. The room was very nice a little small. The only complaint we had was it was very loud. The room doors slam and the airconditioner was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: jenndon
Reviews.Content: We booked this room on Priceline and got a good deal. It is classified as a Midtwon West hotel, but is right on the border of what is Midtown East, so it was an excellent location to shopping and also theatre. They offered to upgrade us to a double room, but we preferred the Q bed, and the non-smoking floor. The bed was very comfortable, new and clean. The bathroom was big, which was nice. The room was small, but it had what we needed. It was quiet and the hotel staff was very helpful. The cappucino machine also provides tea and hot chocolate in addition to coffee and steamed milk, which was a neat little bonus. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty ghastly overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at the check-in time of 15:00 but neither of our rooms were ready for us. We had to wait until 16:30 to get into our rooms. However, they did upgrade me to a suite as they could not provide the smoking room I reserved. There is no fridge, minibar or coffee maker in the rooms, just a lot of high-tech equipment such as plasma TVs (but no cable). Central location and staff friendly but incapable of operating in an efficient manner. View outside the room was some parking lot. Management must do better. I don't think I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to NY and stay, I choose The Shoreham every time. I am constantly recommending the hotel to family and friends, and now to you. I have stayed there on 4 occasions for a length of 2 weeks. The staff is knowledgeable, and pleasant. It isn't a stuffy, up tight hotel. It's uniquely charming, with modern flare and sophistication.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Saintsfan777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shoreham for New Year's Eve after getting a great deal on Priceline. We paid half of what people were paying for a 1 star in Manhattan on New Year's and we booked only 2 days before our stay. The service was excellent. The hotel room was very clean but a little on the small side but was very welcoming after a longggg day in Times Square. The free cappucino's in the lobby was a plus too.:) Great location! Times Square only a short walk away as well as Rockefeller Center. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: sgusm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights in late October of this year (2005). I was a little wary of the construction I had read about here in TripAdvisor, and when I arrived it looked like it would be pretty bad--there was construction inside and outside of the hotel. But once I talked to the staff (who were quite friendly throughout my stay), and got to my room, I was immensely relieved. The room was refurbished--brand new, in fact. It was modern but not too modern (like, say, the Alex or Royalton, which are way too modern); it was not old-world, definitely, but it was still quite comfortable. The room was huge, with a big king-sized bed that was very, very comfortable. The best parts of the room, of course, would have to be the plasma T.V. on the wall in front of the bed (so, so nice!), the Bose sound system, and the very clean, modern shower with five shower heads. The room was, I must say, the best I've seen in the city except for a large suit in the Hilton (and I've seen rooms in the Hilton NY, Michelango, Intercontinentel, Alex, Royalton, Hudson (a horrible, horrible hotel, by the way), and Sheraton Towers). Oh, and the cappucino every morning was fantastic! Downsides: the construction was bad--at one point I heard a few noises, there was a lot of dirt in the hallways and in the elevator, and there was scaffolding outside the entrance; the cappucino-maker stopped working for the last two nights of my stay; only one elevator was working at the time, and it was quite small. On the other hand, it seemed like the construction was ending right when I left, and the restaurant and bar (refurbished, of course) were re-opening. Second, since the fitness center was not open yet, they gave me a pass to Bally's down the block. And, finally, the location is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JackfromParis
Reviews.Content: I was quite looking forward to my stay at this hotel. They advertise themselves as "boutique" and "cool". First of all, the area is ok, not fantastic. It's central and convenient, but you can get better locations if you're loking to go out, do some people watching etc. Here you're pretty much in the business district. But that's ok, not their fault. What is their fault is that they don't tell you that 70% of their rooms are not refurbished and actually really small! I stayed in a unrefurbished room for 2 nights, it was awful. $300+ for this is a rip off. Smelly, old, bad soundproofed, small etc. Furthermore, I requested a non smoling floor, but the woman in the room opposite mine was chain smoking all the time, and despite my multiple complaints they did nothing... so I had to threaten the hotel to report them to relevant authorities for them to investigate the issue. Then they moved me to the refurbished wing, which is nicer, w views on the interior courtyard (awful, but at least quiet). Lastly, the room service is appalling: I wasn't able to eat the chicken, had one mouthful and tasted rotten, brerakfast was really bad, and although some of the staff are nice, most of them are either incompetent or rude (or both). Now that I read previous reviews, I can see this should have come as no surprise. If you want an advice, for a $100 more, you can stay at a W hotel, which is way way better. In any case, very bad value for money, would disrecommend going.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from a weekend at the Shoreham. It is a clean, comfortable hotel in an excellent location. Staff was friendly and helpful with reservations, etc. We spent $400/night for a pretty small room, and apparently we had a deal b/c we booked well in advance. Similar rooms for around $6-700/night for that weekend. That seems excessive for what we experienced. The bed size was a simple double, not a queen, and the bedding was rough with pillows like cinder blocks (we did get feather pillows on request instantly...). The small size of the hotel with boutique atmosphere is a plus. Stays at the Sheraton and Hilton previously felt like a cattle car ride, whereas this stay was more personal and memorable. Note that when you roll out in the morning, the spartan continental breakfast (fruit, yogurt, and granola)--which looks complimentary--is actually $16/person, which is a bit insulting when you're paying $4-700/night. The free access to a nice espresso machine is a plus. Also, a gym will be opening soon, but presumably will require a "donation." I would stay here again, but might be tempted to try a different hotel for variety. I had an excellent stay previously at Le Parker Meridien for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “A complete nightmare!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: happyland
Reviews.Content: OK, to start with, I had read all the good and bad Tripadvisor reviews before I decided to make my booking, and some of the reviews on this site said MAKE SURE YOU ASK FOR A ROOM IN THE NEW WING. I booked a twin room room for three people online (three months in advance) and specified that I would like a room in the new wing. On arrival, I was informed that I couldn't have a room in the new wing as they didn't have accommodation for three people there - something I found very odd considering that we were given a room with two double beds (does this mean they only have single bed rooms in the new wing???). Anyway, while the room itself wasn't too bad, the bathroom was absolutely horrible. Our toiled was blocked and we had to call reception three times to have this fixed. I know that they have since started or even completed renovating the old wing so things may be better but be aware that the bathrooms are still TINY (airplane toilet size - and no, I'm not kidding)! The reception area and lounge of the hotel looked very nice - even better than they did in the photos (!) but the quality of the rooms did not match up in comparison! Anyway, after an OK stay things really started to go wrong when after returning to London I checked my credit card bill and found TWO charges made by the Shoreham on my credit card statement. There was the correct charge relating to my stay AS WELL AS an incorrect charge equivalent to a 4-night stay. As if that wasn't bad enough, after ringing the hotel to get to the bottom of this I was told that the charge was made 7 days prior to me arrival in New York. I'm not kidding but it took over 4 weeks to get this matter resolved. I sent a detailed letter, credit card statements and flight coupons to prove that I had not been in New York at the time the incorrect charge was made, and had to make countless phone calls to a lady called Melissa Bourne. Miss Bourne was the most unhelpful person I have EVER encountered in my life. Every time I called her, she put me on hold while making numerous enquiries. At the end of every phone call she promised to call me back but did not ring me once! I gave her my work, home and mobile numbers as well as my e-mail address and fax number but being totally incompetent she did not ring me back once. It was only when I threatened to take legal action that she said she would arrange for my credit card to be refunded. However, a week later, I still had not been reimbursed. When I rang Miss Bourne again to find out what was going on she had another silly excuse. After yet more phone calls I finally got confirmation that the money had been charged back to my credit card. The Shoreham may be an OK hotel - especially after the new renovations - but I would never ever recommend this hotel to anyone. Not in a million years!

Reviews.Title: “The best staff !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Shoreham recently, most of the time on my own, while my husband was at a Conference. Times like that it is very important that one feels comfortable with the staff, as well as the room & hotel quality. And these guys were terrific! The room was excellent - the next size up from Standard. Very roomy, recently re-decorated & extremely comfortable. They are still undergoing largescale renovations, and from time to time the one lift to my floor stopped working. Amazingly, instead of peeving me after an exhausting day walking round the city, the lovely young Concierge turned it into a delightful adventure for me. He gave me a glass of champagne, carried my shopping bags up 6 flights of stairs, and chatted charmingly all the way up. Absolutely priceless - and I'll definitely try to stay there again when in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay at the Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: zinniaNewYork
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel with Priceline. Asked and received Non Smoking/two bed room. Hotel staff was very friendly. Did not ask for but received a renovated, clean and quiet room on the 8th floor. It was exactly like the pictures. Beds were very comfortable. Coffee machine with many coffe and tea selections was great. The lobby is a little odd with the wall that you can write on but I guess it is a good way to cover up the renovations that are going on. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a night in the newly renovated wing of the Shoreham and it couldn't have been better. The staff was tremendously helpful and accomodating. The rooms were extremely comfortable, especially the beds, and not noisy at all. The lounge, which is becoming increasingly more popular with locals and hotel guests alike, was excellent, its staff all very personable and knowledgeable, and the food and drinks well-conceived for all types of patrons. Of course, you can't beat the location and the value. When the entire renovations are complete, this hotel will clearly give many others a run for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay at The Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: katesmom
Reviews.Content: My mother, daughter and I stayed at The Shoreham for several nights. The hotel has a new manager since the previously posted negative reviews. Manager Joe Reyes, Aaron, Scott and the rest of the staff do everything possible to make guests feel welcome and comfortable. Our room was immaculate and the beds unbelievably comfortable. Wonderful to have a terrace with table and chairs. Location is great for shopping, Central Park and theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Shoreham”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have taken a family vacation to NYC for the past 10 years and this was by far our best hotel experience. We just returned from 4 days at the Shoreham Hotel and what a gem we have found in NYC. The staff was so welcoming and took care of all of our needs. From the champagne when you walk in the door to the 24-hour cappuccino machine and staff, my family and I were in heaven. The Shoreham is everything you could want especially after a long day in the city. With its ideal location, conveniently located steps away from the best shopping, shows, restaurants and even Central Park we were all satisifed (and believe me in my family that is hard to do). Every last detail was taken care of from the robes, to the wireless internet in our room, to the daily paper delivered every mornring and my personal favorite the luxurious bathrooms. Our overall experience was just incredible and we are looking forward to our trip back to the Shoreham Hotel this winter. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Jerrold
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nites in a hot July and found the hotel cool in several ways. Had a problem with air conditioning and the night manager Aaron couldn't be nicer. Cappucino machine was in the lobby (along with sparkling water and champagne). Rooms are NY small, but a huge downstairs lobby with internet made up for it. Of course the loacation is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Tburdick
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of a well-respected friend who lives in the city, we booked 2 rooms at the Shoreham for the week of June 13th. We have all traveled to the city many times and have never had a bad experience, but there is always a first time for everything. Upon arrival, which happened to be one of the hottest days in the city (and we're from Florida), 8 of us walked into the low-ceilinged, closed-in lobby of the Shoreham where losts of tiny halogen bulbs burned brightly, making the small room even hotter. It is definitely decorated in the modern, minimalist style, but the attention to comfort is minimal, too. We were offered Champagne and water from the desk clerk, which was nice, but not the big deal it is made out to be. As we checked in, it appeared they lost one of our reservations, and only one of our rooms was available. We took our luggage down the very narrow corridor to the elevator that could only fit 3 people at a time (without luggage). The elevator, too, had the bright, hot halogen bulbs in it, which I imagine in the cold winter months probably feels nice and cozy, but only made us sweat even more. The one room that was available, had a very small bathroom even by NY standards, and a window AC unit which was not working. At this point, it was hotter in the hotel than it was outside. We left the hotel and came back an hour later to learn our other room was still not available, and the first room had not cooled off at all. One member of our group discovered a hole next to the AC unit large enough to get his arm through. We were told they would send maintenance up to repair the AC unit and waited around another 45 minutes. By this time we figured out we were obviously in the "old" section of the hotel I had read about. We asked if we could be moved to the new section, but they could not accomodate us there. After our 3rd inquiry to check into our other room, which was well after the 3pm check in time, we decided this hotel was not going to suit our needs. We then took it upon ourselves to re-locate to a larger, more comfortable and better hotel located in Times Square. Perhaps if you can guarantee a room in the "new" section, and travel when it is winter, and get a really low rate, it would be worth staying in this hotel, but I won't take my chances with the Shoreham again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Good Price performance.”
Reviews.Author: Tokyomom212
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, Shoreham's location is simply great. When I arrived at 9am, way too early for check-in, they were unable to give me an early check-in, because they were sold out apparently. When I came back after 3pm, they first put me in a quiet room facing the back of the building. The room was pretty nice, but extremey small and dark. I couldn't tell what time of the day it was even if I looked out the window. I immediately felt claustrophobic and asked for a room change. They then moved me to a room facing 55th St. There was nice natural light and surprisingly, not too noisy. The staff, while they seemed rather unprofessional initially, were extremely accomodating in my requests. The rooms you get in the range of $249-289 are good to stay for a short stay. The rooms are small, no bath (only shower stall), no fridge, no minibar... but I thought it was well kept, clean(-looking) carpets, free internet connection, and most of all, the LOCATION. You get the bare minimum essentials in a top location for great price. You kinda wish you had at least a small fridge to keep your drinks, but hey... for few nights, you can live without it.

Reviews.Title: “All I have to say is Cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is NYC, but come on. We shouldn't expect roaches in our room in such a "boutique" hotel. When we complained of the "extra guest" in our room they simply replied "that's NYC." Aweful!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUR”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Shoreham is a small boutique hotel which was under rennovation at the time of our visit. Be sure to reserve "inside rooms" in the new section as an outside room can be very noisy - street noise. The room are small but extremely comfortable and clean. The service is excellent. Given the ever increasing rates of New York City Hotels, the Shoreham was a "value" however the rates will o doubt increase once the new section is completed. Probably the biggest "positive" of this hotel is the location which is a half block off fifth avenue. Yes, we would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Shopping Location block off 5th Avenue!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby is nothing much...think "Asian minimalism". The hotel restaurant was good and not too expensive. The rooms were lovely but slightly small. However, with the clever design elements I learned to really love The Shoreham. I especially enjoyed the window seat and the large walkin shower in the rooms. The hotel can be pricey but is a nice choice for NYC shopping trips.

Reviews.Title: “a great little place”
Reviews.Author: Sonia3110
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, the staff were friendly and helpful and it was well placed to get to major attractions. Woud definitely recommend it for a cheap, clean base for exploring! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Book it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked just one night here when passing through NYC.... great location close to the shops and subway and the lovely Rockerfeller Centre. Rooms not huge, but who wants to stay in. Great cocktails at the bar... try the Cosmolini!!

Reviews.Title: “Yikes, Can my room be any smaller????”
Reviews.Author: sharoncubets
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was extremely small with a super teensy weensie bathroom. I nearly bonked my head on the sink while wiping my ass. The closet can fit a wallet and a pair of slippers. Oh can't forget about the darn ironing board fit for a midget like my grandmother; board rested on the bed for crying out loud. Only thing I like about this boutique Hotel is their free one-time use citrus-scented lotion in a blue bottle.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel & Hotwire are operating a scam for the unwary”
Reviews.Author: cmacscott
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel. The air conditioner was loud and wouldn't cool the room. The toilet ran all night. We couldn't sleep and the staff refused to move us. We had used Hotwire to purchase the hotel, which we will never do again. Apparantly they set aside a few uninhabitable rooms for Hotwire customers and then refuse to move the guests or fix the room. Also Hotwire is refusing to even discuss an adjustment to our bill. (4 stars--they rated it) The bed wasn't a normal sized Queen. The paint in the bathroom was peeling of the walls and the calking aroung the tub was all dried and peeling. They play hideous nouveau techno fusion music 24 hours a day. Most rooms got towels & a New York times delivered daily, but not us--again another Hotwire bonus I assume. Hotwire is a fraudulent scam.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: ajryan_1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Shoreham on June 23-27. The location was very convenient for us. It was easy to walk to many places nearby. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Ours had a window facing the street so we could hear everything going on outside. The staff was our biggest problem. They didn't have answers to our questions and seemed put out by us asking them for things. The concierge was awful. We asked for directions to the subway and had to practically beg for a piece of paper to write them down on ourselves. Overall our stay was ok, but with all the hotel choices in NY I probably wouldn't stay there again. The rates were reasonable at about $160/night.
